results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.

We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.
results.name: Partners in Business: North Jersey Referrals Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

BNI Dream Team As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, August 11th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
I'm off for a while between classes, and up for some staycation adventure!  Let's visit the Transit Museum in downtown Brooklyn, near Brooklyn Heights. 


Here are two interesting-sounding exhibits:

New York's Transportation Landmarks: In celebration of the 50th anniversary of New York’s Landmarks Law, this exhibition features the city’s most famous and least known historic transportation structures including train terminals, subways, airports, ferry and pier buildings, bridges, and landscaped parkways.


Spanning the Narrows--The Verrazano Bridge at 50: In celebration of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge's 50th year, explore the contruction of this masterpiece of engineering and see how it transformed the region as the final link in the metropolitan arterial highway system. Photographs, architectural and engineering drawings, maps, models and public relations materials provide fascinating documentation of the planning, design, construction, maintenance and operation of the bridge.

How to meet us: I'll be waiting in the lobby near the admissions desk, holding my hand-scrawled MEETUP sign. Please meet us by 11am. If you're late, ask a guard to direct you to the Landmarks exhibit.

Admission: $7 regular admission; $5 for seniors.  We do also have our own $1 fee to help defray the costs of maintaining this meetup group, payable to the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a handwritten MEETUP sign
results.name: A weekday morning trip to THE TRANSIT MUSEUM

results.description:
Join other breastfeeding moms in a casual and relaxed setting to ask your most pressing breastfeeding questions like:


* How do I know if my baby is getting enough?
* Is my latch correct?
* Why does it hurt my left breast and not my right?
* Will my nipples ever feel the same again?

This 1-1/2 hour weekly support group will be run by International Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC) Elina Arulraj.

Elina is a MSPT, IBCLC has been an International Board Certified Lactation Consultant since 2009 and has been empowering moms and helping babies breastfeed since 2009. Prior to that she worked at Mount Sinai Medical Center’s lactation support groups and Labor and Delivery, and NICU units alongside three International Board Certified Lactation Consultants who had over 30 years of experience.

Drop-in. Babies welcome.

Cost is $25
results.name: Weekly Breastfeeding Support Group

results.description:
I've given this seminar (or one very similar to it) back in April, you can see the comments from people who attended it here.

The problem with the in-person seminars is many people can't make them on the day/time the occur and people not in the area couldn't go no matter when they happen. To try and get this important information out to more writers, we have teamed up with Writer's Digest University to offer this course online. Now, usually I don't charge for my seminars, but Writer's Digest has a complex and expensive amount of infrastructure to host these seminars, so there will be a fee for this. It's not paid to me, you'll need to register at Writer's Digest University, here is the link.

Here are the particulars:


• What: Goodreads: The Venue That Can Make Your Writing Career

• When: Tuesday, August 18, 2015 from 1:00 p.m. - 2:30 p.m EDT

• Where: Online - sign up here

• Who: Presented by Michael and Robin Sullivan

• Cost: $79.99 

I should note that while the stop time is 2:30, I'll remain available until all questions are answered so there will be plenty of time for Q&A. Also, if you can't make the time, sign up anyway as all attendees will have full access to the recording after the course.


Full details can be found at this he link, but here are some highlights:


WHAT YOU’LL LEARN:

• How to build your Goodreads author page for maximum effectiveness

• How to utilize Goodreads pre-release to generate “book buzz”

• How to maximize the Goodreads' feeds to get your books noticed

• Avoid pitfalls when interacting in groups that can get you banned (or worse)

• How to build a Goodreads giveaway that stands out from the crowd

• How to build “rabid” fans that spread the news of your book far and wide

• How to utilize “fringe features” of the site to get even more exposure

• How to adjust your strategies as your audience grows

• WHO SHOULD ATTEND?

• Writers who want to foster word-of-mouth viral marketing

• Writers who have finished books or will be launching a title in the future

• Writers who aren't currently utilizing Goodreads

• Writers who have tried to use Goodreads but became confused or overwhelmed

• Writers who want to maximize results while minimizing time spent online

• Writers at all levels of their career who want to build a rapid fan base

• Writers who want to avoid pitfalls that have given some authors bad reputations with readers

I hope you'll check it out. I really think this is an amazing opportunity. I hope to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.writersdigestshop.com/goodreads-the-venue-that-can-make-your-writing-career
results.name: Goodreads Online Seminar: The Venue that can make or break your writing career

venue.name: Periscope - Your Smart Phone - Follow Me @ KateGaffin to Attend

results.description:
Nail Your 'Who' and Watch Your Business Transform - A 20 Minute Business Building Talk on Persicope 

Download the Free App on Your Smartphone and Follow Me @ Kate Gaffin

Several years ago, I left a high paying job to start my own business. However, I had no idea what business I wanted to start. Sounds crazy, right?

One thing I did know is that I was very unhappy with the dysfunction at my job and I never wanted to be working with people who were not generally happy, upbeat, inspiring and supportive.

And so I wrote down all of the qualities I wanted to see in the people I worked with. After all, I'd be spending a lot of time with them. Once I had this list, I came up with a product line and created an entire business around it. Over the next 7 years, I saw my lines featured on Access Hollywood and in top Parenting Mags and I had high end boutiques all around the world carry them. I also had an Angel Investor come on board and and secured some great corporate sponsorships. Most importantly, it was one of most amazing times of my life.

And, it all began with 'Nailing My 'Who.'

Before I launched Connecting to Greatness, I went through the same process...I nailed my Who and created a networking group of over 5,000 NYC Area Entrepreneurs and Business Owners.


Nailing Your 'Who' could be one of the most important things you do for your business...and yourself on so many levels.

Join us!
results.name: Transform Your Business by Nailing Your 'Who.' A 20 Minute Talk on Periscope

We are meeting at La Casita Yarn Store at 253 Smith St between Douglas & Degraw from 2-4pm. The Carroll Street F stop is the closest and the 57 bus stops at Douglass St.

The yarn store is small and cozy and has a cafe with yummy snacks, small meals and drinks - including wine and beer!  In order to support LaCasita, who generously hosts our weekly meeting, we ask that you buy something while attending.

results.description:
Central Park is a three dimensional work of art with the intended effect of “refining and elevating people’s spirits.” Come explore the souther section of the most visited public space in all of the United States and connect your understanding of it with the monuments that define the spaces we cover on this tour.

Itinerary:
• Grand Army Plaza
• Doris Friedman Plaza
• Central Park Zoo
• The Mall
• Bethesda Terrace and Fountain
• Strawberry Fields
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins by the Pulitzer Fountain in front of the Plaza Hotel (between 58th & 59th Sts. and 5th Av.) map here. Tour concludes on Central Park West and 72nd St). map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Central Park is a landmark to remember. Connect your memory of it to works of art that will be there for time immemorial.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be in front of the Pulitzer Fountain on 5th Av. between 58th and 59th streets.
results.name: The Art and Culture of Central Park

results.description:
Join us we welcome Fashion Photographer David Turner as he discusses “Location Lighting”.  The topics to be discussed are:

"Balancing Strobe with Ambient" the math behind the technique
"Day for Night" lighting techniques and power packs explained
"Low Key on Location" separation lights with the Narrow Beam Reflector and other techniques
"Modifiers Demystified" which modifier is right for the shot and their many uses
"Thinking like a photographer, the Artist Process"
"Studio Portraits Outdoors" Discussing the quality of the light, the direction of the light and the color of the light to blend with the location

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/DavidTurner_HEAD.jpg?itok=c70mqqDs After starting his career in Milan, shooting features for top fashion magazines, fashion photographer David Turner’s twenty years at W Magazine made him a favorite of such designers as Ralph Lauren, Tommy Hilfiger and Donna Karan. His magical portraits of entertainment legend Eartha Kitt and Buffalo Bills superstar George Wilson are classic examples of the photographic fingerprint that David puts on all of his assignments.

David’s images are beautifully lit, graphic in composition and powerfully engaging. Famous for his fast set ups and thoughtful variations, David is known for making it work and saving the day. "DT" as he is  known in the industry has mad problem solving skills and seemingly endless energy for creating images while having fun along the way, make him one of New York’s top creative talents.

David has always been very generous with his time and talents to young photographers. They all love and appreciate his guidance and agree he is an amazingly talented teacher.  DT teaches at Hallmark Institute of Photography and teaches his own highly successful lighting classes at the Maine Media Workshop and teaches a summer weekend workshop at the International Center for Photography in New York City.
results.name: SEMINAR: Location Lighting Master Class with David Turner

results.description:
The time has come to WRITE!

For this meetup we may have some small chit chat here and there, but our purpose is singular: to get some writing done. If you have been looking for a time and space to get busy adding words to a current project, then this meetup is for you. I will bring along my bag full of prompts if anyone wants to peruse them to get started, but, for all intents and purposes, this meetup is an opportunity to support you in whatever you need to be working on now.

We will be meeting in the events room at the Todt Hill-Westerleigh Library on Victory Blvd close to CSI. They are tables and chairs for us, so bring your notebooks, journals or laptops with you to get your work done. There are outlets in the room and the library offers free wi-fi. We are permitted to have food and beverages, but they must remain in the room (they can't be brought out to the library itself). There is also a parking lot and bus stop right outside the building for your convenience!
results.name: August Write-In!

results.description:
Tuesdays can be depressing, so we're putting some fun into them!  Come celebrate with members of Gotham Social Happenings and more than a dozen other meetup groups!

=============================================

Instructions - If you wish to attend, please use this link to see full details and to RSVP: 

http://www.meetup.com/GothamSocialHappenings/events/224236265/


Why - Posting a meetup in many groups gets more people to attend, which makes for a better event.  However, this creates multiple signup pages, which make it hard for hosts and organizers to keep track of the total headcount - and even harder for members to see who else is coming!  It is much better if everyone registers in the same place.  Thank you!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

In a competitive job market which has a largely corporate complexion, it is good to be able to distinguish yourself from the competition. The most effective way to accomplish this is to lead with your strengths and to show your accomplishments. The medium of story allows us to convey our value and communicate with those that can assist us or employ us.

In this interactive talk, coach Win Sheffield will describe developing the trajectory of your stories to attract and engage your listener. By learning the basics of telling the story of your accomplishments in the language of your listener you will:

-Be able to use your contacts with others to develop your ideas of what interests you

-Answer interviewers’ questions so that they see your value to their organization

-Inspire confidence in your listener of your value to them

Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church
7 West 55th Street
No reservation necessary

results.description:
Unit testing AngularJS

Slides

Testing Angular code requires too much boilerplate. In this presentation I will show ng-describe - a BDD helper that removes all extra code and allows to start unit testing in seconds. The ngDescribe makes injecting specific services to be tested very quick and intuitive. It also provides advanced features, like mocking services and HTTP responses. As I describe testing different Angular aspects; from simple values to custom directives; I will point out how ngDescribe has a user-friendly API. With ng-describe in your tool belt there is no more excuses not to unit test your code.


Gleb Bahmutov is JavaScript ninja, image processing expert and software quality fanatic. After receiving a PhD in computer science from Purdue University, Gleb worked on laser scanners, 3D reconstruction, and panorama-based virtual tours at EveryScape. Later Gleb switched to writing browser data visualization software at MathWorks. After a year, Gleb went back to the startup environment and developed software quality analysis tools at uTest (now Applause). Today Gleb is developing real-time financial analysis tools at Kensho. He blogs about software development topics at 

http://glebbahmutov.com/blog/

 and links his projects at 

http://glebbahmutov.com/

Agenda:

6:00pm - Doors open, Food, Drinks and Socializing

6:10pm - Announcements

6:15pm - Talk from Gleb Bahmutov 

(any remaining time) - Lightning Demos

8:00pm - The end

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

results.description:
Join us at the IBM Watson office for our kickoff meetup of NYC Data Science! We have three great talks in store for you.

Presentation Line Up: 

Henri Dwyer -  "Predictive Maintenance”

Kate Shillo - "Venture and Data Science"

Mike Tamir - "Text Understanding, Word2Vec, and Neural Networks” 

Agenda: 

• 6 pm: Doors open & networking


• 6:20 - 8 pm: Speakers present

• 8 pm: Closing time


*Note: Attendance Capacity: Due to the nature of the space, we are capped at 58 attendees. First come, first serve; so arrive a few minutes early :)

Predictive Maintenance:

Henri Dwyer will discuss predictive maintenance - determining the condition of equipment that is currently in use, and predicting when and why equipment is likely to fail. First, Henri will describe the key concepts in predictive maintenance, as well as some applications. Next, he will build a workflow using data from the PHM society data challenge, showing how to go from raw data to the the final predictions. Henri will highlight how to avoid common pitfalls, give examples of what features can be engineered, what techniques and models can be used run to ultimately come up with a robust predictive maintenance model.

Meet the Speaker: 

Henri Dwyer is a data scientist and engineer working on building the best platform for data scientists at Dataiku. Before, he did physics research on air pollution and solar cells. He received an MSc in Engineering from Columbia University and a BS and an Ms in Engineering from Ecole Polytechnique in Paris. Henri now lives in New York City and is always keen on discovering new data science problems to solve.

Text Understanding, Word2Vec, and Neural Networks

Supervised text classification is hampered by the need to acquire expensive labeled training sets. By leveraging algorithms similar to Word2Vec and other neural network based text embedding algorithms one can create vector representations of documents that enable a model to be successfully trained with a drastically reduced training set. By using this technique the implementer can now devote low investment to acquiring a small volume of labeled data examples in order to train proximity thresholds, without devoting significant resources using traditional text classification algorithms which typically require training volume examples that are orders of magnitude larger.


Meet the Speaker: 


Mike Tamir serves as Chief Science Officer for Galvanize, supervising Galvanize's Immersive Education and accredited Masters Programing.  He has led several teams of Data Scientists in the bay area as Chief Data Scientist for InterTrust and as Director of Data Sciences for the Sears Holding Company. Mike began his career in academia serving as a mathematics teaching fellow for Columbia University before teaching at the University of Pittsburgh.
results.name: August Kickoff: 3 Great Talks

results.description:
Dear Makers,

Ever wished to be able to print with flexible filament?


Wait... you don't even know it was possible at all?

Or you have done it for a while, and are now an expert...

Whatever your expertise with 3D printing in flexible filament, this event is for you.

NinjaFlex

Our partner NinjaFlex will give an introduction on the technology, behind the scene expertise, technical information, and more. Don't miss that oportunity to chat live with the guys who make that happen!

Settings

Come share your best settings, your tips and tricks,  with other makers using flexible filament for printing. Or possibly share your frustration with some issues? and hopefully someone will be able to help, be it iMakr engineers, NinjaFlex gurus or one of your peers in the attendance.

Whatever printer you're using, you should be able to enjoy flexible printing!

Best objects

If you've ever printed anything nice, fun, beautiful, useful, etc. with flexible filament, bring it! please come with it a show it to us and to your peers. iMakr will also showcase some creations from MyMiniFactory, and Ninjaflex as well.

Guess what: our partner NinjaFlex will offer free rolls to the best objects!

So don't miss this chance to win!

And of course, as usual, we'll have a drink, bits and bites.

Enjoy!

See you then,

iMakr Team

results.description:
DigitalOcean is the world’s fastest growing cloud hosting provider built for developers. Our mission is simple: we’re passionate about making complex infrastructure simple and delighting our customers with a seamless experience that brings them joy. New users can easily deploy a blazing fast cloud server in 55 seconds with an intuitive control panel interface, which can be replicated on a larger scale with the company’s straightforward API.

MEETUP AGENDA 


6:00pm - Welcome / Networking

6:30pm - Hacking

8:00pm - Lightning Talks 

8:45pm - Announcements

9:00pm - Post-meetup: Watering Hole

For our lightning talks tonight, we have:

Travis Irby who will discuss Email in Meteor with Mandrill. 

Travis is a freelance Javascript developer who enjoys using Meteor, React and Node. Follow him on Twitter: @travisirby

Greg Lewis will also give a lightning talk on his firm's flagship product Nudger with the provocatively titled presentation: Want to Help Bring Meteor to Enterprise Companies?

Greg is the Founder and CEO of Nudger, which shares the same name with its product. Nudger uses Meteor to automate companies’ workflow so they can get more tasks completed, in less time. Their desktop and mobile app analyze our customers’ data to suggest optimal task assignment, prevent problems that may arise, and make real-time workflow adjustments. Nudger is hiring.

Eric Typaldos from the Hive team will demonstrate the power of Meteor as the basis of their collaboration application (http://hiveteams.com). Reach out to him at [masked] . 

Looking forward to seeing you all at the meetup!


Got an idea for a keynote presentation or lightning talk?  Just leave a tweet-sized description on the Hack Night of your choice and we'll help you get set up.  We're looking for tutorials, walkthroughs, talks, discussion topics, and production apps about or related to Meteor.

Please note that after the lightning talks, we've added a new item to the schedule called "Announcements."  This is an open mike period where you can let other members know about your projects, if your firm is hiring, if you're available for a gig, or if you're looking for collaborators for your cool Meteor application or extension.

If there's a topic you'd like someone to talk about, post that too!

And don't worry, you're not required to get technical.  Meteor is new, and we're learning together.

*** Please be sure to include your First and Last name on your RSVP by 3pm on August 18th to be checked in at Digital Ocean's building. ***
results.name: Meteor Hack Night

results.description:
Our book this month will be The Mark of the Dragonfly by Jaleigh Johnson. It has magic! It has steampunk! Piper has never seen the Mark of the Dragonfly until she finds the girl amid the wreckage of a caravan in the Meteor Fields. The girl doesn't remember a thing about her life, but the intricate tattoo on her arm is proof that she's from the Dragonfly Territories and that she's protected by the king. Which means a reward for Piper if she can get the girl home. The one sure way to the Territories is the 401, a great old beauty of a train. But a ticket costs more coin than Piper could make in a year. And stowing away is a difficult prospect--everyone knows that getting past the peculiar green-eyed boy who stands guard is nearly impossible. Life for Piper just turned dangerous. A little bit magical. And very exciting, if she can manage to survive the journey.

At the end of the meeting we will decide next month's book. Please join us for a fun night of discussion and chatting about all things books!
results.name: Let's Discuss Mark of the Dragonfly as the Book of the Month

results.description:
PRODUCT OF THE MONARCHY
is an exercise that shows an assimilation of our consciousness through popular marketing of brands and icons. Our thought process is intricately intergraded with the imagery we consume everyday. This language of imagery is fed to us casually and forcefully. This is the very essence of what is merging our collective thought process and our cultures.
This consumption of commercial propaganda actually makes us closer to one another without noticing that certain barriers have been breeched. I neither desire to judge it negatively or positively in my art, but I have to allow freedom and honesty through my work. I recognize that it is a force in our lives, and that there is someone at the wheel that is not us.
I think recognizing this idea is to exert your power to steer it in a way, that you find advantages to your beliefs. I always like to give the quick example of growing up in the islands and asking for a coke. After a while asking for a coke does not mean you want specifically a coca cola it just means you want a soda. The brand in essence has taken over a communication bridge; and further more, it does this, in a culture that may be foreign to its origins.
Imagery was made to communicate and gain leverage to interact with greater accessibility to truly understanding each others desires. It does this by showing us beautiful things that seduce our spirits and intellects. Knowing this I think it is interesting to entertain possibilities never before seen and make more obvious those we see everyday.That awareness is what I talk about in my work, I believe I will make people take notice of what they are consuming not just with their mouths but also with their eyes. Part of me grew up more american then americans living in the US, and part of me always felt a little asian in some way because I consumed so much of their imagery while growing up.

PRODUCT OF THE MONARCHY is a cultural result of how we communicate with each other, and what we want from another, and how we want to be understood or seen. My brush strokes expose this interaction, my palette and subjects expose the effects of our communication and consumption.

Ticket: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/opening-reception-product-of-the-monarchy-a-new-exhibition-of-gregory-st-amand-tickets-17973640643
results.name: Opening reception - "PRODUCT OF THE MONARCHY" - Exhibition of Gregory St Amand

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Hellooo to all you LOA-AFF'ers- not to worry, a name contest is underway to find a more suitable name for members :).

We are in the midst of planning a really special event to officially launch the LOA- Adventure, Food and Fun group and thought it would be great to get our wonderful members together sooner rather than later, so we decided to have a Pre-Launch Mixer. 

In order to take advantage of the beautiful summer weather the event will take place at Tropix on the Mile in Freeport. We've got a great private room on the water just for us and we'll have some complimentary light snacks and a cash bar. No charge to attend.

In addition to being a great chance for members to meet one another, it will also provide an opportunity for Jacob and I to share our vision for the group and hear any suggestions or ideas that anyone wishes to contribute. 

Tropix has live music and a good crowd that night so anyone who wishes to stay on after our event is certainly welcome to do so. It will be a great night and we're looking forward to meeting all of you so please put this onto your calendars and help us kick things off with this great new group!.
results.how_to_find_us: The event will be held in the private waterfront room near the dining area.
results.name: Fantastic Pre-Launch Mixer

results.description:
Tired of the rat race? We don't blame you... But no need to worry!!! Come to our CashFlow in Jersey City and learn how to get out of the rat race while having fun.


During the CashFlow in Jersey City you will see how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for money to pay liabilities. You will also have the opportunity to network with local successful real estate investors and learn from their strategies.


Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. Cashflow in Jersey City is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. It makes learning fun and is recommended for adults and children age 10 and older.

We create a perfect environment to meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.

This meet up is by invitation only, so you need to answer the questions in the RSVP for us to be able to contact you with the details of this event.


http://www.youtube.com/v/uqZayPhdUJc?version=3
results.name: Let's Network & play CashFlow in Jersey City

results.description:
Meet @ Absolute Coffee at 327 Atlantic Ave for introductions at 6:15. What's your feminist background? What issues are foundational to women's freedom? How do race and feminism intersect? Who is/are your feminist hero(es)? At 6:55, we'll make our way over to The Commons to join in on the monthly discussion/planning meeting. Read below on how to prepare for the meeting:


FROM NWL:


"In our August 18th meeting we will discuss NWL's founding statement "What We Want, What We Believe"<a></a>. Please read the statement and join us to discuss:


What resonates with you? What do you disagree with? How can we rebuild a strong women's liberation movement that will put male chauvinism on the run again?  

We'll also discuss projects and how you can get involved.

NWL's priorities are abortion/birth control, overthrowing the double day, and feminist consciousness raising. Our <a>Women of Color Caucus (WOCC)</a> meets separately from white women to better understand how white supremacy intersects with other forms of oppression. We also work closely with <a>Redstockings</a> on "History for Activist Use." The "This Oppresses Women" sticker came out of a women's liberation class organized by NWL and Redstockings last fall. "
results.name: #ThisOppressesWomen with National Women's Lib (pt 2)

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Cat, Steve and Myself will be available to run.
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

Nuts & Bolts Singles Party (Prizes, Light Appetizers, Drink Specials)!
As seen on ABC news, a Nuts & Bolts Party is a unique, fun way to meet single professionals!

Get full event details and your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/nutsboltsmixer.html
Special ticket price only for Meetup members: $15 (Must use discount code NUTSMEETUP at checkout. Get tickets at the above link).

THIS IS NOT A DESI SPECIFIC EVENT. ALL ARE WELCOME TO ATTEND.


HOW IT WORKS...
• Women get nuts... Men get bolts.
• Walk around the room and mingle while trying to find the nut/bolt that fits with yours. You will have multiples matches in the room.
• Every time you find a match, you'll get a raffle ticket from the event host for a chance to win prizes.
• Then you can get out there and find more matches for more chances to win prizes!
This is not overly structured/rigid. You can feel free to relax and mingle at your own pace.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

* FREE Light Appetizers
* Suggested Age Range: 23 to 45
* Drink Specials From 6:30 to 7:30! -- $5 Mixed House Drinks, $5 Mojitos, $5 Red Sangria, $5 House Wines, $5 Select Beers!!
* Nuts & Bolts Icebreaker
* Win Prizes!
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Trendy or Professional: No tank tops, t-shirts, baseball caps or sneakers.

Get full event details and your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/nutsboltsmixer.html
Special ticket price only for Meetup members: $15 (Must use discount code NUTSMEETUP at checkout. Get tickets at the above link).

Get full event details and your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/nutsboltsmixer.html
Special ticket price only for Meetup members: $15 (Must use discount code NUTSMEETUP at checkout. Get tickets at the above link).

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting and sells out every time! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, this is a great experience for all! Walk from table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Just $29 to taste 24 wines (normally $33).  Price will go up as event gets closer.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Aug-18-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Aug-18-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

Join NYC's hottest fashionistas at MEETUP's #1 FASHION MIXER!  200+ attend every time we do it! And it's FREE!! (Just RSVP w/ group)

This is a multi-group event with a great fashion show, drink & food specials, DJ, and breath taking views of the Manhattan Skyline at NYC's highest luxury penthouse/rooftop!

• Drink & Food Specials until 7pm

• DJ spins from 7pm-12am!

• LIVE FASHION SHOW starts @ 9:30pm!

• Meet the models and designer after the show

• Professional Photography (Cameras allowed)

• NO COVER.  Just RSVP w/ group & say MEETUP at door

Come check out the hottest fashion trends of the season!

Fellow Meetup organizer Lyndon will be your host on 34th Fl (where DJ is located).  Optional name tags will be available.

Dress: Business Casual. No shorts, sneakers, sweats, hats.  Jeans ok.  21+.

Why does your RSVP say +99? THIS IS MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 200+ WILL BE ATTENDING. RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

results.description:
Join us at one of the coolest lounges in NYC for a night of networking and drinks with many of the best Entrepreneurs NYC has to offer!

Atmosphere: 
 - The dress code is Business Casual. 
- We will provide name tags for everyone that attends. We ask that you put your name and industry on your name tag. 
- Make sure you bring enough business cards.

Time is Precious: 
- Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.

Admission: 
- FREE for the First 75 RSVP on Meetup 
- $20 Thereafter (No Exceptions!!!)

Drinks: 
- 2 drink norm, 1 drink min. Because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event, all our networking events require a "2 drink norm, 1 drink minimum!"

***Since this is a drinking establishment, all attendees must be 21+.***

******************************************************* 
Venue Sponsor: 


We are constantly looking for new and exciting venues to use.  If you have a venue and you would like us to consider using it please contact Trang at [masked].

**************************************** 
SPAM:

Please don't spam our members in the comment section with your company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be ban from the group.
results.name: NYSBN: Aug 18 Business Networking Party @ Gansevoort Park Rooftop

venue.address_1: 11 Times Square (NE Corner of 41st St and 8th Ave)
venue.name: Microsoft

results.description:
Building Apps for multiple platforms is hard. Building apps for multiple platforms, with 1 engineer and working part-time is harder. In this talk, Greg Avola will walk you through how he built Untappd, a social beer check-in and discovery service, using Cordova to provide a seamless experience across all 4 major platforms. Greg will discuss the pros and cons of building Hybrid apps and how you can get started.

Speaker

Living in the craft beer haven of New York City, Greg Avola is the co-founder and CTO of Untappd, a mobile beer check-in service. Some people enjoy reading books, others enjoy watching movies, but Greg’s passion is to code. Being able to combine his passion for development and craft beer allowed Untappd to be born. To date Untappd has had more than 2.2 million users. In NYC Greg works full-time for ABC News on the technology team, which is responsible for ABCNews.com both on desktop and mobile.

Pizza will be provided courtesy of Xamarin
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor: Music Box
results.name: Native or Hybrid – The Path of Least Resistance: An Untappd Case Study

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, this is a great experience for all! Walk from table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Just $29 to taste 24 wines (normally $33).  Price will go up as event gets closer.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Aug-18-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Aug-18-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

group.name: #1 NYC Singles Group - Meet, Mix, & Mingle

results.description:
This event is hosted by New-York-Entrepreneurs-and-Startup-Network, biggest network in NY. 

Over 350 people attend.

Join us at one of the coolest lounges in NYC for a night of networking and drinks with many of the best Entrepreneurs NYC has to offer!

Atmosphere:
- The dress code is Business Casual.
- We will provide name tags for everyone that attends. We ask that you put your name and industry on your name tag.
- Make sure you bring enough business cards.

Time is Precious:
- Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.

Admission:
- FREE for the First 200 RSVP on Meetup
- $20 for everyone else

Drinks:
- 2 drink norm, 1 drink min. Because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event, all our networking events require a "2 drink norm, 1 drink minimum!"

***Since this is a drinking establishment, all attendees must be 21+.***

***************************

results.description:
We are sharing our love and knowledge of Scala and bringing it to a wider audience... YOU!


Come prepared with your laptop and install JDK, SBT, and IDE (Eclipse or IntelliJ) and create your first worksheet  https://gist.github.com/dspeele/79a7a4c78f4c040084fb.

In this class of the NYC Scala University we will take a look at how we can leverage the Scala type system to enforce invariants in our code. Also we will talk about a purely algebraic datastructure called a monoid. Monoids enable us to compose and parallelize our code in a very simple way.

Jeroen Soeters will be leading this class. He works as a developer for ThoughtWorks. He has worked mainly on large scalable event-driven systems using techniques like DDD, CQRS, MSA and event sourcing. Jeroen is also a functional programming aficionado and co-organizer of FP AMS, the largest functional programming meetup in the Netherlands.
results.name: Algebraic Datatypes and Monoids for Fun and Profit

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday 6:30-8:30 all summer long! Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.

Intercambio is free and all skill levels are welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

results.description:
Hello, XPers:

First let me attempt to stem any confusion: this is the actual invite for the "Remote Pair Programming" talk. The older event, which was never scheduled, will be removed so we can start our sign-ups fresh. In short, if you want to attend this event please visit the link and sign up!

This month we're happy to present a friend and fellow XPer, Joe Moore, who has years of extensive remote pair programming experience. We're very excited for his talk! Details below: Description:
Distributed agile teams need not forgo the valuable discipline of pair programming.
Thanks to ubiquitous high speed internet, advances in online collaboration technologies, and the need to source talent wherever they might be, remote pair programming is becoming more common. Remote pair programming is surprisingly simple to implement, but it's not just about bleeding-edge technology -- a good attitude is just as important as good technology. Joe will walk you through how your distributed team can successfully implement remote pair programming, allowing you to not only reap the same benefits as in-person pairing but also bring your teams closer together, even if they are miles apart.

Bio:
Joe began writing software in the late ’90s at a large insurance company. He soon moved to Evant, an early case study for eXtreme Programming and Agile software development processes. In 2005 Joe joined Pivotal Labs as a founding member of Pivotal’s Ruby on Rails practice. Joe has led eXtreme programming projects for a wide variety of clients, ranging from one-person start-ups to the world’s largest social networks. Since 2010 Joe has remote pair programmed full time with Pivotal coworkers and clients around the world. He also blogs about his his passion, remote pair programming, at http://remotepairprogramming.com.

See you soon!
results.name: Remote Pair Programming: A guide for distributed teams

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own.

results.description:
This is a three-night introductory course on React.js - the highly popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces. 

DATES:


• Tues, Aug 18th - 6:30 - 9:30pm

• Wed, Aug 19th - 6:30 - 9:30pm

• Thur, Aug 20th - 6:30 - 9:30pm


AGENDA:

5:45pm: food

6:30pm: workshop starts


PREP WORK:

1) Have Git installed on your laptop

2) Create a GitHub account (if you don’t have one)

3) Be familiar with npm and how it works (installing dependencies, etc.)



GOALS: 

• Learn the fundamental concepts of React

• Learn to apply those concepts through building small apps

We'll start with the absolute basics, so you don't need any experience with React in order to enroll. However, we do expect you to be comfortable using JavaScript.

Each day will be split into two modules. The first module consists of a lecture, while the second consists of programming tasks, where the you and a partner will apply your newly acquired knowledge via pair programming.

Please ONLY sign up if you can make all 3 days. There will be no refunds.


The instructor is Per Harald Borgen, a Norwegian entrepreneur, web developer and Founders & Coders graduate. He's been working with React.js the past six months, using it to build a variety if different apps. He's currently a front-end developer at a Norwegian startup called Xeneta.

=========================================

TOPICS INCLUDE:

• JSX syntax

• Components & structure

• Props & State

• Interactivity

• The virtual DOM

• React's one-directional data flow

... and much more!

=========================================

FAQ:


1) What do I need to bring?

Your laptop and whatever IDE you use to code. You will be paired up with a partner for the exercise portion.

2) Are there any prerequisites for this course?

Yes, you should be comfortable with JavaScript. This course is better suited for people that are already developers.

3) Why are you charging for this course?

We're using the fees collected to buy everyone food and drinks. It comes out to be around $16/night.

4) Can I attend if I can only make one or two out of the three days?

No, please only sign up if you can attend all three nights since space is limited.

5) Will you offer refunds?

No, since spots are limited and demand is high, we want you to be sure you can make it before you sign up.

=========================================

SPONSORS:

A big thanks to our sponsors!

Hook & Loop is an internal creative agency and R&D think-tank for Infor, a software company that specializes in enterprise software ranging from financial systems and resource planning to supply chain and customer relationships.  And they are currently hiring front-end devs!

Founders & Coders is a not-for-profit social enterprise and freelance co-operative that is owned and managed by graduates of its free coding program.

Xeneta is the world's largest online sea freight intelligence platform.

=========================================

NY JavaScript expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf Code of Conduct.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email Joanne at [masked].
results.name: React.js for Beginners [3-Night Workshop]

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't open our door from 6:30 - 7 pm while meditation is in progress. Kindly refrain from ringing our buzzer during this time.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

HTML and CSS are the building blocks of every website.

Together, they can be used to build functional and beautiful websites. Come be introduced to the wonderful world of HTML and CSS and get your hands on some introductory code! You'll leave with a basic web page created and a new understanding of the fundamentals of programming.

results.description:
The Citygram Project aims to deliver a real-time visualization/mapping system focusing on non-ocular energies through scale-accurate, non-intrusive, and data-driven interactive digital maps. The first iteration, Citygram One, focuses on exploring spatio-acoustic energies to reveal meaningful information including spatial loudness, traffic patterns, noise pollution, and emotion/mood through audio signal processing and machine learning techniques. Citygram aims to create a model for visualizing and applying computational techniques to produce metrics and further our knowledge of cities such as NYC and LA. The project will enable a richer representation and understanding of cities defined by humans, visible/invisible energies, buildings, machines, and other biotic/abiotic entities. Our freely Internet-accessible system will yield high impact results that are general enough for a wide range of applications for residents, businesses, and visitors to cities like NYC and LA. Our collaboration with NYU CUSP has been especially fruitful in the context of measuring and quantifying urban spatio-acoustic noise and using NYC as a research lab. Citygram-Sound Project is a collaboration between NYU Steinhardt, NYU CUSP,  and CalArts. 


About Tae Hong Park 

Tae Hong Park is a composer, music technologist, and bassist. His work focuses on composition of electro-acoustic and acoustic music, machine learning and computer-aided music analysis, research in multi-dimensional aspects of timbre, and audio digital signal processing. Dr. Park has presented his music at national and international conferences and festivals including Bourges, ICMC, MATA, SCIMF, and SEAMUS. Among the ensembles and performers that have played his work are the Brentano String Quartet, California E.A.R. Unit, Edward Carroll, Ensemble Surplus, Zoe Martlew, Nash Ensemble of London, and the Tarab Cello Ensemble. Professor Park is author of Introduction to Digital Signal Processing: Computer Musically Speaking (World Scientific, 2010). He is the Chief Editor of Journal SEAMUS, serves as Editiorial Consultant for Computer Music Journal, served as President of the International Computer Music Association (ICMA), and is Director of NYU Steinhardt's Composition program. He received his Ph.D. from Princeton University.
results.name: Citygram Sound Project - Tae Hong Park, NYU

results.description:
Learn How to Get out of the Rat Race! 

Cashflow 101 is a fun way to learn the basic concepts of Real estate Investing. Your objective throughout the night will be to get out of the rat race and into the fast track! In other words you have to find a way to get out of that 9-5 that we all dislike and step into the life you always wanted to live.

How do you get out of the race race you ask?

Your total monthly passive income has to be higher than your total monthly expenses.

Cashflow 101 is an educational tool in board game format which aims to teach the players concepts of investing by having their money work for them in a risk free setting (play money) while simultaneously increasing financial literacy and stressing the imperative nature of accountability.


There are two stages to the game. In the first, "the rat race", the player aims to raise his or her character's passive income level to where it exceeds the character's expenses. The winner is determined in the second stage, "the fast track". To win, a player must get his or her character to buy their "dream" or accumulate an additional $50,000 in monthly cash flow.

In place of “score cards”, there are financial statements. The game requires the players to fill out their own financial statements so that they can see more clearly what is happening with their money. It generally shows how assets generate income and demonstrates that liabilities and 'doodads' are expenses.
results.name: NY/NJ Cash Flow game night

results.description:
Book Description:
Like an elegantly chilling postscript to The Metamorphosis, this classic of postwar Japanese literature describes a bizarre physical transformation that exposes the duplicities of an entire world. The narrator is a scientist hideously deformed in a laboratory accident–a man who has lost his face and, with it, his connection to other people. Even his wife is now repulsed by him. His only entry back into the world is to create a mask so perfect as to be undetectable. But soon he finds that such a mask is more than a disguise: it is an alternate self–a self that is capable of anything. A remorseless meditation on nature, identity and the social contract, The Face of Another is an intellectual horror story of the highest order.

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Mansions of the Soul by H. Spencer Lewis

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 1: "I Go To Prepare a Place For You"

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

The definitive work on reincarnation and the soul, this Rosicrucian classic explains all about the soul and its cycles of reincarnation. The ideas expressed here will remove from your consciousness any fear of so-called death.

Reincarnation is one of the world's most disputed doctrine. The belief in reincarnation has had millions of intelligent, learned, and tolerant followers throughout the ages. Ringing through the minds and hearts of students, mystics, and thinkers have always been the words: "Why Are We Here?" Reincarnation has been criticized by some as conflicting with sacred literature and as being without verification. This book reveals, however, in an intelligent manner the many facts to support reincarnation.

Quotations from eminent authorities, and from Biblical and Sacred works substantiate reincarnation. It places it high above mere speculation. This book is without exaggeration the most complete, inspiring, enlightening book ever written on this subject. It is not a fiction story but a step-by-step revelation of profound mystical laws. Look at some of these thought-provoking, intriguing subjects: The Cosmic Conception; The Personality of the Soul; Does Personality Survive Transition?; Heredity and Inheritance; Karma and Personal Evolution; Religious and Biblical Viewpoints; Christian References; Between Incarnations; Souls of Animals and the "Unborn"; Recollections of the Past.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Mansions of the Soul

In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness.  

You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! 

The cost is $20

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining


DISCRIPTION:

In three subsequent visits with different groups of Vietnamese food fans, much of the menu was explored with a particular emphasis on rarely seen dishes. Bot chien ($6.50) is a delicious heap of starchy, boxcar-shaped rice cakes scrambled with eggs — it would make an excellent brunch, if the city's mimosa mills only knew about it. "So nuoc dua" is a lovely ceramic bowl of gargantuan two-bite mussels immersed in a thick coconut-milk curry, which glistens a dreamy shade of green. One of the most expensive things on the menu is ca luoi trau chien don ($24.95), a beautifully fried whole flounder — many of the small bones are edible — with a cup of "Vietnamese sauce" on the side: deep red, sweet and sour, and laced with finely chopped shallots. Dump it all over the fish before you dig in. The sauce tastes almost French.


MENU:

http://www.yelp.com/menu/pho-vietnam-87-new-york-2


FOOD GALLERY:

• Marinated beef cubes sauteed w. salad 


• Pho Tai Bo Vien

• Deep fried flounder with Vietnamese sauce

• Grilled Pork Chop, Chinese Sausage, fried egg over rice.

RESTAURANT GALLERY:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/pho-vietnam-87-new-york-2

results.description:
Hosted by Nova Patch (Shutterstock) and Meetup

Unicode is much more than just characters. The Unicode Consortium defines open standards for collating, parsing, and formatting data in much of the world’s languages. The Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) is the largest standard repository of locale data along with specifications for its use, and is a powerful resource for software localization.


The Unicode CLDR is quickly becoming the de facto locale standard with widespread use among companies, including Google, Apple, and IBM; projects ranging from Linux distributions to Wikipedia; and increasing support in many programming languages. This talk provides an introduction to software localization and highlights popular CLDR-based open source libraries in a variety of programming languages.


Topics include localized formatting of:

•  Numbers, percents, and ranges of numbers

•  Prices and currencies

• Dates and times

as well as localized sorting lists of strings


Nova Patch (@novapatch) is software engineer on the International Search team at Shutterstock, specializing in internationalization, localization, and multilingual search; and focusing on developing a search and discovery experience that supports the world’s languages, writing systems, and cultures. They are an open source developer, contributor to the Unicode CLDR, and member of the Unicode Consortium.
results.name: Unicode beyond just characters: Localization with the CLDR
