Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
ROOM 5412 - Winter Garden 

WordPress has transitioned from being blogging software into being software that can be used to power just about any type of website from ecommerce to classified ad, membership and everything in between. In the past, finding and customizing a plugin and/or writing custom plugins would be required to add in the extra features.

However, WordPress Toolset makes this easier by offering plugins that work together to let you quickly create custom web applications. In this presentation we'll cover:

• An overview of WordPress Toolset

• Using their Types plugin to create custom post types for an application

• Using their Views plugin to use HTML and shortcodes to customize how the custom post type data is shown on the front of the site

• Using their Layouts plugin to perform drag and drop editing of Bootstrap based themes

• Using their Access plugin to limit access to content based on user role so different content can be shown to logged in users than website visitors (for example)

• Using their CRED plugin to allow website users to create WordPress posts of a specified custom post type right from the front of the website

• How all of these plugins work together to make creating a web application quick and easy

Watch as a web application is created from start to finish demonstrating the use of these plugins and how they work together.

PRESENTED BY: John Cook

OPENING PRESENTATION:  How to Use WordPress to Prepare to Get Your Book Published

Every writer writes a book with the intention to publish it, whether it’s fiction, non-fiction or a children’s book. However, understanding what it takes to actually write and publish it, get your book out into the marketplace, and attract attention and/or grow your sales can seem like a mystery of its own.  In this presentation, you will learn how to leverage WordPress to 
prepare for publishing your book and master the art of writing and publishing your book! 

Expect to learn:

• Proven techniques to use Wordpress to prepare to get your book published.

• The basics for writing effective books that sell.

• The secret to using your book as your “hook” in your industry, business, organization, project or career.

• Top strategies to leverage your book for various audiences, opportunities and markets.

Presented by: Jennifer S. Wilkov


GET ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE AT OUR HELP DESK:  

Our experts will be available throughout the evening to help you with your WordPress issues and answer your questions.


ABOUT THE SPEAKERS:

John Cook is the owner of Adapt WP, LLC where he develops websites and mobile phone apps for clients. He has been using WordPress since 2006 and enjoys creating video tutorials, writing books, and speaking about WordPress to share his knowledge with the WordPress community.


Jennifer S. Wilkov is a #1 international best-selling award-winning author, an award-winning freelance writer, a media personality and executive producer, the Literary Agent Matchmaker™ and a respected book & business consultant in her business called “Your Book Is Your Hook!”  She is also a blogger for books for the Huffington Post, and a columnist for the award-winning magazine PUBLISHED and Book Marketing Magazine.
results.name: Quickly Create Web Applications with WordPress Toolset

results.description:
This running group is for anyone who just wants to go for a run and make new friends. If you're looking to get into better shape or become a better runner we can help you with that. But our main focus is to enjoy the run around Central Park.

We run anywhere from 3-6 miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. We will meet at Columbus Circle behind the Gold statue (The Maine Monument)to warm up stretch and have a chance to meet everyone and coordinate the run.

The New York Running company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has changing rooms, and free bag check also has lockers but you have to bring your own lock and closes at 9pm.

We can start off as a group and run as a group if everyone wants to run at the same pace but others are more than welcome to break up into smaller groups for those of you who might want to run a little faster.

After each run we head to our local bar DJ Reynolds to grab a drink or two and get something to eat and it gives us a chance to get to know each other.

I will post what I'll be wearing and my number in the comments section the day of the run.

results.description:
EVERY Tuesday Night! 

Looking for special open mic in Manhattan? It's the New York City Open Mic @ the very cool Funkadelic Studios smack in the middle of midtown.

FULL BACKLINE. 

Produced by the long-running Inspired Word open mic series, which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - comedians, musicians, storytellers, singers, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, performance artists, dancers.

30 slots, 7-minute time limit for poets, comedians, storytellers, 8 minutes for musicians. 

A warm, supportive community of artists. Real crowds. And a great place to network.

*****

When: Every Tuesday Night

Where: Funkadelic Studios
http://funkadelicstudios.com/
209 West 40th Street (corner of 7th Avenue), 5th Floor
Manhattan, NYC

Time: Doors open for open mic sign-up @ 7pm, show starts @ 7:30pm

Purchase advance tickets for a guaranteed performance slot @ http://tueopenmicnyc.eventbrite.com.

Cover charge: $10 for solo performers or audience, $15 for performance duos (performers only/one slot), $20 for bands/groups (3+ performers/one slot)

No age limit.

Since this is a very popular open mic, we strongly suggest purchasing a ticket through this page to guarantee a spot on the open mic list. 

*****
By subway, take the A/E/C/B/D/F/M/R/Q/N/1/2/3 to 42nd Street. 

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

*****

For almost 20 years, Funkadelic Studios NYC has been the place for all types and levels of musicians to jam and practice their art. The New York rehearsal space has seen it all, from a band’s first practice, to major label acts preparing for a European tour!  Indie-folk, jazz, hip hop, rock, blues, country, electro, you name the genre, it’s been practiced at Funkadelic.
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor
results.name: NYC Tuesday Night Open Mic @ Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

When you RSVP, please post your pace time and/or training run distance for the day.
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community.

If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least twice before applying.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.

For all of our entrepreneurs, we have been invited to participate in a FREE, live, business coaching event presented by the team at Owner's Up. The event is a live workshop which will give you an opportunity to network with other entrepreneurs and subject matter experts, as well as, find out more about how Owner's Up can help you solve growth and accountability issues.

Here are the specifics:
Date -  Tuesday, August 18th
Time - 7:00pm - 9:00pm
Location: 548 West 28th Street, New York, New York 10001

5 game-changing productivity hack tools for every solo-preneur’s toolkit

Guts, Grit & Integrity

Owner's Up Business Coaching Workshop

How:

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

New York Session Symphony, Inc. (NYSS) is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt nonprofit organization whose purpose is to provide the opportunity for accomplished musicians to rehearse and perform significant classical works and new compositions in the New York City area.

We rehearse weekly at Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts in NYC, 165 W. 65th St, 6th floor. 

Auditions take in the context of rehearsal. No solo playing is required.

NYSS is Pay-to-Play: $10/week, $30/month, $250/year.

BRING YOUR OWN MUSIC STAND.

Current repertoire includes:

BRAHMS Variations on a Theme of Haydn

BRUCH Kol Nidrei 

BEETHOVEN Symphony No. 7

WAGNER Lohengrin Overture

RAVEL Piano Concerto in G 

MAHLER Symphony No. 4 

RESPHIGI Ancient Airs and Dances

BEETHOVEN Triple Concerto 

MENDELSSOHN Symphony No. 1 

We are currently accepting the following instruments:

Violin

Viola

Horn 

Please email your name, instrument and a brief bio.

Join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup at Cobblestone's pub. We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Monopoly to Ticket to Ride to Zombicide! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our awesome, not-too-loud, well-lit venue, please purchase a bite to eat or at least 2 drinks (soda is fine!).  Cobblestones informed us that there is a $15 minimum per person.

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  I am sure between us all, we should have it.

results.description:
OK - a slight change. I'm adding a few whites and will discourage reds, unless you've already bought one.

You may bring Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Bourboulenc, Picpoul, Clairette and Viognier.

You might recognize those grapes because they are traditionally grown in the Rhone Valley.

Otherwise, we're still sticking to especially pink that are GSM blends ideally.

Although if you bring a wine from Tavel AOC, you get a bonus. I'm not sure what that bonus is.

After listening to the group, I encourage that you bring a white or a pink. Bring chilled, if possible. And if there are a couple of you who might bring ice, let me know directly, and put it in your RSVP.


A grenache rosé, that's fine. 

GSM means Grenache (or Garnacha), Syrah (or Shiraz), and Mourverdre (or Monastrell or Mataro). Cinsault, also. 

The rules: plan to spend $35. $20 for your wine, $10 for an appetizer and $5 for the space. In the RSVP just tell me what you want me to buy, and I'll pool the resources to get a higher price point wine and some expensive Arthur Avenue Prosciutto because I like all of you. the extra cash helps me justify the party to the church.

The $10 includes us getting a couple sparklers for those who start on time.

As always, volunteers who bring ice are well appreciated. 

And if you can come by 6:00pm, you get a special glass ahead of time.

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
Check out our website:   www.NYCommunityChoir.com for  more information and to pre-pay for sessions and save money.

LOCATION
520 Eighth Avenue - 16th Floor


Join us weekly on Tuesdays for a soulful and uplifting musical experience that’s designed to include anyone who loves to sing – shower singers and professionals alike. 

Our sessions incorporate vocal technique training, choral singing, music-oriented meditation, community and relationship building activities, creative play, and musical improvisation and games all within a supportive, non-judgmental family environment. 

Music selections are soulful, spirit-driven Gospel, Broadway, Spiritual, World Music, chanting, Pop/Rock with lyrics that are universally accessible to people of any religious belief (no He, Him or Jesus). 

Each session is co-taught by industry seasoned professionals: Artistic Director, Amy Silverman, a wonderful accompanist Emily Imes, and, at most sessions, we also have a guest powerhouse musical director. We’re lucky to have many talented and in-demand musical directors and conductors who feel committed to our success and growth. 

Plan to be musically guided and inspired by the leadership of  Lesley Kernochan, Troy Burton, Chris Dilley and other fantastic surprise guest conductors.


===================================

WHAT TO EXPECT:

Choir Rehearsal + Jam Session + Singing Technique Training + Expressive Creative Activities + Amazing Family-like Supportive Community of People Who Love to Sing + Conscious, Spiritual and Soulful Approach + Professional, Dynamic Leaders


===================================

WHAT PARTICIPANTS HAVE SAID:

"Amy, words can't express (maybe I can sing it???) the amount of love and gratitude I have for you and everyone for participating last night. The experience was powerful, healing and joyful. I felt whole and complete in my voice in a way I've never felt before. I've always wanted to sing but haven't had the opportunity to really pursue. It's great the Universe has brought me this one that feels perfect. What a great combination of community building and sharing our hearts through song. I was very moved and can't wait to come back. Much love to you all!!" - Doug Larson

"It was an amazing experience, thank you very much for putting this all together. Ive been looking for a space like this, to express myself, for a long time and I cant believe I found it!!!! I'm looking forward to our next gathering. Thanks again!!!" - Vicky Vernier

===================================

REGISTRATION AND LOGISTICS

What does it cost?

$10 for first time guests (pay in person)


$25 pay in person
$22 pay in advance online

And discounted packages are available when you pay for 5, 10, 15 or all of the sessions in a group.

 


===================================


QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

Do I have to commit to coming all the time?
Nope - just come check us out - we hope you'll want to come consistently but there's room for everyone, even drop-ins!

Do I have to be a "singer"?
No - you just have to love to sing!

What do I need to bring?
Voice recorder or Smart Phone
Water Bottle
Open mind and heart
Desire to sing and connect playfully


I can't attend, how do I find out more about future opportunities?

 

Send an email to  [masked]  and say "please add me to your mailing list!"


I'm keeping everyone updated in the NY "I Love To Sing" Community Choir Group 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/529840427030696/?ref=ts&fref=ts

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

Danny

results.description:
Come join us at our August meeting where we will feature the following presentations:

We'll have an in-depth comparison of Apple Photos vs. Google Photos. Bruce Mittelman and George Ajjan will demonstrate both applications and services and talk about their similarities, differences, and everything else you need to know about hosting your photos in the cloud.

Bob Helmond will give a demonstration of how to set up a RAID on your Mac computer. A RAID (Redundant Array of Independent Disks) is two or more drives configured to share or duplicate data. Come learn how using RAID can protect your data as well as increase system performance through improved read and write times.

Louis Perez will give a discussion on the best hard drives for various use cases and the maintenance software you need to know about to keep your hard drives functioning correctly.

Jerry Glacken will give a quick overview of the latest OS X vulnerabilities, namely the DYLD_PRINT_TO_FILE privilege escalation vulnerability and the Thunderstrike 2 firware worm.

Plus we'll discuss all of the latest Apple news and have our "Question & Answer" session where our experts will try to solve your problems.

As always, a meeting you won't want to miss! Hope to see you all there!

About NJMUG: 

The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (NJMUG) is open to all persons, whether they are a current or future Macintosh user. An individual membership in NJMUG costs $30.00 per year. If you are thinking of becoming an NJMUG member but would like to check the group out first, we allow non-members to attend two meetings as a "guest". Once you become a member of NJMUG you are entitled to attend all monthly meetings as well as gain access to all of the member benefits including member discounts on hardware and software, free USB flash drive, monthly distribution files, and eligibility in all raffles and member giveaways.  Check www.njmug.org for more information.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the meeting room at the back of the library.
results.name: Apple Photos vs. Google Photos - RAID - Hard Drives & Maintenance Software

This is a fun, beginner level class that begins by introducing the basics of Bachata dancing!

The class warm-up will focus on footwork, turns, body movement and proper technique. We will work on proper frame and connection in order to build comfort with leading and following, all while learning a fun dance pattern for you to use on your next romantic night out!

results.description:
Bohemia-based manufacturer, Dart Manufacturing, will be featured at the Suffolk County Inventors and Entrepreneurs Club August 18th meeting. Dart Manufacturing is a multifaceted company providing design, prototyping, manufacturing and production services to a wide variety of clients.

The speaker will be Vice President Arto Cinoglu who specializes in conceptual development and new product design. He has over 25 years of experience in product development, R&D and automation. He worked in R&D and engineering departments as Sr. Design Engineer/Project Manager of various companies where he utilized his skills and analytical ability to create new products/systems. He currently has four patents and six patent pending designs in the medical, transportation and private sectors. The Inventors and Entrepreneurs Club meeting will take place on Tuesday, August 18th from 7 p.m. – 9 p.m. in the Media Room of the H. Lee Dennison Building 100 Veterans Highway, Hauppauge 11788. (Use the EAST Entrance to the building.) A valid ID is needed at the door.

Inventors Club meetings take place each month and there is an opportunity for everyone to introduce themselves and their invention or business idea, a speaker or special program and lots of time to network. There is no charge and no registration is required to attend the meetings.

See you there!

Brian Fried

results.description:
Secret Science Club & the Albert and Mary Lasker Foundation present the "2015 Lasker Public Lecture in Honor of Al Sommer" with Neuroscientist Gregory Petsko 

WARNING... the year is 2050... your brain is undergoing malfunction... memory evacuation will begin in 5...4...3... memory evacuation now in progress. No new memories can be stored.

Sounds like a bad sci-fi plot? You may as well quit worrying about the Zombie Apocalypse. What's really coming is a massive collision between the human brain and America's changing demographics. As the population ages, we're facing a tsunami of neurodegenerative diseases, and the incidence of Alzheimer's is projected to double. Yikes. 

To prepare for (and possibly change) this brain-boggling future, neuroscientist Gregory Petsko is researching the mechanisms underlying neurodegenerative conditions and working to develop new drugs. He asks: What's the connection between Alzheimer's, ALS and Parkinson's? What treatments are being investigated? Why do some very elderly people NOT get Alzheimer's? Are there scientifically proven ways of improving and protecting our cognitive health?

The Mahon professor of neurology and neuroscience at Weill Cornell Medical College and director of the Appel Alzheimer's Disease Research Institute, Gregory Petsko writes frequently about science and culture, and has been a featured scientist at TED and TEDMED, and on PBS's NOVA. 

This edition of the Secret Science Club is sponsored by the <a>Albert and Mary Lasker Foundation</a>. The Foundation works to foster the prevention and treatment of disease and disabilities by honoring excellence in basic and clinical science, educating the public, and advocating for support of medical research. Yeah!

Before & After: Sample our wet-wired cocktail, the Memory Palace; groove to synapse-stimulating tunes; and stick around for the scintillating Q&A.


For more information about the Secret Science Club, contact [masked]

Or visit us on the Web at <a>http://secretscienceclub.blogspot.com</a>;

__________________________________________________


SECRET SCIENCE CLUB WAS OUR FIRST MEETUP, AND NOW IT'S A TRADITION! Please arrive by 7:15pm, so we can get in line to sit together. Meet at the main bar!

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta and Michelle McKenzie.  Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ.  

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)


Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

results.description:
Here is a unique opportunity to join a healing group that meets regularly to support your needs using the amazing potential of Tapping.

There will NOT be a lot of discussion or socializing because we will be too busy Tapping on specific and general issues of our Emtional and Physical concerns using EFT and something called Tong Ren.

EFT is well known for eliminating the causes of emotional distress. Many people are also aware of using EFT for physical well being. Sometimes we need to look at the emotional aspects that may be behind the issues of concern, and sometimes we just tap directly on the symptoms and notice if we get relief just from that. Its very nice when this happens and it happens a lot.

Tong Ren is another form of healing using tapping but unlike EFT it doesnt involve any dialog to describe the issues of concern. We just tap on a surragate model (Tong Ren) as if we were doing acupunture on a real body with intention of healing and it works!!!!

We'll meet at Jain's home in Scarsdale every 2nd and 4th Tuesday evening and whoever is interested in joining us is welcome. The only stipulation is that whatever issue you bring to our attention you let us tap on it.
results.name: Tapping Meetup for Emotional and Physical Healing with EFT and Tong Ren

results.description:
NOTE THE NEW DATE, EVENT HAS BEEN RESCHEDULED!!
So here's the plan, we'll meet at 7:45 At the intersection of Delancy Street and the FDR drive.
Eventually we'll progress across the pedestrian foot bridge across the highway into the east river park and head to the location indicated on the map. (it's a sunken circles just to the north of the Williamsburgh Bridge inside of the East River Park)
IMPORTANT!
1) Remember to inflate your tires to the the manufacturers recommended pressure (it's engraved onto the sidewall of your tire in case you aren't sure). Overly/underly inflated tires can lead to flats!
2) Wear your helmet! Helmets are important. If you are not wearing one, you will not be allowed to participate. If you don't have one - I have a few extras. Message me in advance and I may be able to lend you one.

This lesson is for moderately experienced riders.  
Bring your mountain bikes, cruisers, hybrids, and road bikes.*

We're going to start with the basics.
First we'll teach you a survival stance that will give you the stability you need to move onto bigger hurtles.

We'll apply that to going down curbs. Then we'll try two steps. Then three. Then four. Then five!


After that we're going to combine the survival stance with a bunny hop.
After practicing this we'll apply it to hopping up curbs.

Bring your wheels. Strap on your helmet. And learn how to handle yourself on the streets of NY. 

*Road bikes are okay please do not bring your expensive racing rig! While it is possible to ride down stairs on one - it's not recommended - especially for a first lesson.
results.name: NYC Bike Street Survival Lesson

results.description:
***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.0 and above)***


Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights from till 11 pm.

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:

1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff.

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.

4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:

• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.

• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!
results.name: Tuesday 8pm Tennis at Lincoln Park - Experienced 3.0+ Players Only

results.description:
Inspirality Art Night is a time to relax, connect with your creative side, play and let loose!

Art night is also a great time to plant a seed and create something new in your life. What have you been putting off?


- Career change?

- Ask for a raise?

- Go out on a date?

- Move?


Tonight is the night you get to create it, put energy behind it, share it, declare it and get inspired by "IT" and paint it to life.


WHAT HAPPENS:

- Guided Meditation:  you will be brought to a place of relaxation

- Meditative Art Practice: Your “IT” will be the inspiration for your painting

- Materials: Watercolors and paper. Materials are included.


In this workshop you will get:

- Play time!

- Touch base with your creative side

- Insight into what you really want

- Opportunity to say it out loud and get "it" moving!

- Supportive, safe group environment

- A beautiful watercolor to take home with you


Space is limited. Reserve your spot! $25

http://www.meetup.com/Inspirality/events/222340764


Testimonials:


"Wow! It has has opened up a whole new world of creativity for me. And it's a fun nurturing environment with like minded individuals". - Tracey M.


"I had no idea what I was doing my first art night, but you said to just go with the flow. Let the colors reflect my energy...It's intriguing to even entertain my creative side, its fun!" - Liz F.


"It offers a time to reflect and focus that we might not otherwise give time to in our busy lives. Expressing through art was a great way to interact with our passions, in less restrictive way, outside of words". - Ann Marie B.


"I find it a very peaceful, pleasurable outlet for Self Expression in an Inspirality setting". - Marcy C.


www.inspirality.com

With almost 5 stars of total 113 Review at Yelp, we must try this place:

49-11 Roosevelt Ave
Woodside, NY 11377
Neighborhood: Woodside

(718)[masked]

According to one Yelper:

Sik Gaek's seafood was very legit and the place was no gimmicky at all. It's the live octopus and live lobster place in Woodside, Queens with a sister resto in Flushing.


It contained two live octopii (moving), live lobster (moving), live abalone, sea snail, razor clams, crab, mussels, shrimp, baby octopus, ..., in a broth (similar to soondooboo) with udon.

 Picture of our previous events

2013


2011 event


2012

2013


Out of all the sea specimens, the live lobster was the most tasty. The sea snail was great too.


With the octopus, you have the option of having one (or both) served on the side, so you can eat it raw while moving. Even 20 mins after it was cut up, its pieces would move when poked.

I think the place is open from 10 or 11am until 4am. They are located on the intersection of 49th St & Roosevelt Ave, a 15min drive from Midtown East (you can street park), or a short subway ride on the (7) to 46th St/Bliss St in Sunnyside, Queens. The resto is technically in Woodside.

If you go, order the watermelon soju too. It comes in a large watermelon, and tastes very good.

I highly recommend this place to seafood lovers. The food was fresh and delicious. It's a must for adventurous foodies! Yes, I'm talking to you, Yelpers.

Sik Gaek
49-11 Roosevelt Ave (& 49th St)
Woodside, Queens

Access the webinar here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email. 


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>) 


----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

Join us this week as Jeff Castellano will explain about internet marketing and how it can improve your business.  Jeff's company, New Tech Services Inc. is set up to guide and direct businesses in obtaining the most up to date technology including website design.   Jeff will review the history of how technology has progressed over the last 20 years.  In addition, he will explain in detail about the internet and how it is being used today for marketing and what online tools are available to us.   


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

results.description:
The streets of Lower Manhattan are alive in history and in daily activity. What began as a small trading outpost has grown to house institutions like the New York Stock Exchange and the World Trade Center. On this tour you experience the most historical site in all of the United States and others of immeasurable historical significance. The information presented will unveil new realities and perceptions that typically lay unseen.

Itinerary:
• Alexander Hamilton U.S Customs House
• Wall Street Bull
• Trinity Church
• New York Stock Exchange
• Federal Hall
• World Trade Center
• St. Paul’s Chapel
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:

Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the National Museum of the American Indian at 1 Bowling Green) map here. Tour concludes at City Hall Park map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Space is a hot topic. So is what and whom should be allowed in it.

results.description:
Lets' do it again and enjoy these beautiful pools while we can. Less than 3 WEEKS  to go! Come take a break from the  "hot trails" and cool off with a refreshing swim at another local  gem in Park Ridge, NJ with Room to swim! (adult swims called if needed)

MEET JAY GLASER  BY THE ENTRANCE AS WE ARE HIS GUESTS OR GIVE HIS NAME WHEN YOU COME IN .   (meet to the right of the diving boards if possible) I will not be there so if someone can make and set up a meetup sign by the table, chairs you will be at, that would be helpful! LOOK for those who signed up and please welcome newcomers.

There are grassy areas and many free chairs available (first come basis) so you may want to bring your own lounge chairs, umbrellas and blankets. Food & Refreshments with healthy choices are also available to purchase. Option to eat at Peppercorns just up the road from the pool. (turn left upon leaving parking lot on Colony and Peppercorns will be on  your right at the corner)

Bring  something to share,  cards, etc and don't forget the sun protection and bugspray!

Stay for an hour or two or  stay til closing at 8 if you choose!  Admission is only $5.50 weekdays and $7.00 weekends for seniors, $10 for adults weekdays and $14 weekends the whole day and you do not have to be a resident!  Senior Residents are FREE.

We only have til Labor Day, to enjoy these pools, so let's take advantage while the sun is shining!! Hope to see yah there. Let's "air out" those " tired dogs”!

Directions From Rockland County: Take Rt 45(Chestnut Ridge Rd) toward Jersey to  Grand Ave..

Turn left onto Grand Ave..

Turn right on Spring Valley Rd. at light.

In a short distance turn left on Colony Ave. at Peppercorn Restaurant sign.

Pass Peppercorns restaurant immediately on your left and pool parking lot will come up shortly on your right.  LOOK FOR THE PARK RIDGE POOL SIGN ON THE ROCK.   Park and walk across the blue bridge to the entrance.

FOR additional DIRECTIONS GO TO: http://swim.isport.com/swimming-pools/us/new-jersey/park-ridge/park-ridge-municipal-pool-1018734 Enter your address and click on directions box.

Inclement weather cancels.  Always check the day of an event for any changes.  See photos below for landmarks.

Note diving boards and area to the right above (if not available look for meetup sign)
results.how_to_find_us: MEET JAY GLASER AT ENTRANCE / OR give his name when you come (MEET IN the area to the right of the diving boards)look for those who signed up

results.description:
By now you've probably heard about mirrorless cameras and how they are changing the way photographers capture high quality images. Join Sony Associate Artisan Miguel Quiles as he walks you through the process of transitioning from shooting with DSLRs to Mirrorless cameras. In this minute presentation Miguel will cover everything including

Advantages of Mirrorless cameras over DSLRsHis favorite settings & featuresLens choicesRecommended accessoriesAnswer audience questions and much more! 

After the presentation Miguel will do a live portrait shoot using the highly anticipated Sony A7RII! You'll see first hand how he creates some of his signature looks and how you can use those principles to take better images. Simply put, you won't want to miss this! 

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/MiguelQuiles2_HEAD.jpg?itok=wnAdfJZk

Miguel Quiles is a commercial wedding & portrait photographer based out of New Jersey. He's been involved in the photography industry for over 15 years, starting off first as a salesman at a local camera store. Since that time, Miguel has been refining his skills and pushing the limits of his creative abilities through the medium of photography. As a self-taught photographer, Miguel hopes to share his experience and knowledge with new and upcoming photographers who wish to take their work to the next level.

Follow Miguel Quiles at www.miguelquiles.com, Facebook, and Twitter

results.description:
If you want lots of excitement and something to do to get you through the week, come race with us Wednesday nights.   About 30 boats in 4 classes race around the buoys in Raritan Bay.   Boats range from J109s to J24's, Shields, Beneteaus.   Many of the captains are international racers and very competitive.

Races start at 6:30, but you have to get on the boat, get it ready,  and out to the race area, so plan to be there, if you have RSVP, by 4:30-5pm.  

Often, regular crew is on vacation during the summer and substitutes are needed.  Some of the larger boats can always use an extra hand and crewing is a great way to learn how to sail.  

Afterwards, join us at the bar and for supper.

If you want to come crew, let me know in advance with a direct email with contact info: cell# and email so I can find you a boat. 

Sail fast, live slow.
results.name: Crewing Opportunities

results.description:
With a name like Anthony’s Coal Fired Pizza, you’d think the specialty of the house would be, well, coal-fired pizza. And you’d be right: it is. But there’s another item on the menu worth ordering, both for its incomparable flavor and unbeatable price: Meatballs with Ricotta Cheese. You’ll find them under the “Italian Soul Food” label on the menu — and they most certainly fit there.


Most days, two large meatballs cost just $4.95; four are $9.95. But on Martini and Meatball Wednesdays, you buy a $6 martini and you get an endless supply of meatballs — for free.  I love a great martini and a great meatball, but who knew they’d go so great together? The Bar really fills up on Wednesdays,  I will try to be there by 5 and save a high top table .

The deal goes from 5 to 10 p.m.

The meatballs come with a nice size slice of focaccia and a generous scoop of ricotta cheese.  The bar staff is friendly and happy to accommodate the crowd.  And yes, if you’d like to combine both the specialty of the house and this special dish, the meatballs are also outstanding on the pizza. Martini optional.
results.name: Meatballs and Martinis! White Plains Happy Hour

Join in for some crafting, cupcakes (or other sweets) and craft beer! It is LIC Brewery Week (Aug 16-22) and there are four great breweries to hit up, sample brews from. Hit all four breweries in the week and you can be entered into a drawing. There will be local beer infused treats at Pink Canary Desserts and some walking in between the breweries to cancel out some of the calories. 

Pink Canary Desserts is located a half block down from the 21-Van Alston G Train or a couple minute walk from the Jackson Ave or Hunter's Point 7 Train (it takes about 5 minutes to get there from Midtown. There is also a Citibike station 2 blocks away. 

Rockaway Brewery is about a 5 minute walk from Pink Canary and Big Alice is about a 10 minute walk from Rockaway Brewery and close to the F train and bus stops. 

Transmitter Brewery and the LIC Beer Project are also in the hood, but may have to save those for Saturday. :)

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Economics of Communication: Keynote Panel 

Your communication alone can make or break your career. Highly successful businesses require effective communication habits in pitching, fundraising, team dynamics, negotiation, and in marketing. Through this keynote panel, learn how your communication habits may be propelling you forward or holding you back from reaching the highest levels of success. Network and join us in Chelsea at WeWork for a lively discussion on how your communication affects every aspect of your business.  *Although this event is FREE you must be registered to attend.*

Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-economics-of-communication-keynote-panel-tickets-18110744725

Panelist: Angela Jia Kim, CEO and Founder, is an Eco-beauty entrepreneur and intuitive business mentor, Angela Jia Kim, believes that the best beauty tip is to live your dream. She pulls from her experiences as an “accidental entrepreneur” who built the Savor lifestyle brand from scratch to seven figures, jet-setting concert pianist, New York City (not house) wife, and mom to a kindergarten CEO to help others from beauty to business at omaroma.com andsavorthesuccess.com. 

Panelist: Jessica Peltz is a Madison Avenue veteran turned venture capitalist at kbs+ Ventures, where she focuses on early stage investments in startups looking to transform the media and advertising industry.  She is a frequent speaker within the NYC startup community and has been featured on CNBC, Fox Business, and popular podcast ThePitchDeck.  In addition to being a bi-coastal mentor at top accelerators including UpWest Labs in SF and Entrepreneurs Roundtable in NYC, Jessica has a global footprint and has developed strategic relationships with over 200+ startup organizations.

Panelist: Victoria Pettibone, Vice President of Astia, brings an entrepreneurial background to her work at Astia, as the former founder of a social enterprise in the media space. She has received The Avon Hello Tomorrow Fund Award, recognizing her work on projects that empower women, and The Harlequin More Than Words Award for being a “real life heroine”; and being named the March 2007 Women’s Health Magazine’s “Action Figure, 


Moderator: Kelly Hadous, Founder and CEO, of <a>emiisor</a> an online education marketplace solely focused on communciation training and CEO of <a>Win The Room</a> a public speaking company. Kelly is a certified executive coach, an active public speaker who has trained thousands of entrepreneurs, politicians, and corporate executives from speaking on large stages to commanding the board room. For several years, she was an active mentor to NYU's Poly Tech's Incubators on Varick and Metrotech. 

This Event is sponsored by WeWork

Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-economics-of-communication-keynote-panel-tickets-18110744725

results.description:
We are happy to invite you to New York's leading Microsoft Azure User Group Meetup - designed to bring together New York's Microsoft Azure development and infrastructure community to talk about challenges, roadmap, what we'd like to see in future releases, and overall user experience.

Topic:

IT Transformation via Interconnection Oriented Architecture

Abstract:  

Enterprise Business Models are interdependent & must collaborate via ecosystems to succeed. Enterprises must react in real time, adapt quickly to change, and leverage digital ecosystems to create new value and growth. Interconnection Oriented Architecture™ integrates the physical and virtual worlds where they meet, shifting the fundamental delivery architecture of enterprise IT from purpose built datacenters to those providing internetworking and collocation. Equinix provides the critical building block to implement  IOA™ across a Global Platform with unmatched ecosystem density and vendor neutrality.


Speaker: 

Bob Goban is a Global Solutions Architect at Equinix, and has over 20 years of experience in the IT industry. 

At Equinix, he works with customers to develop and implement migration strategies into carrier neutral multi-tenant data centers. Prior to Equinix Bob was at  the New York Stock Exchange where he was Director of Network Engineering and Operations for the Secure Financial Transaction Infrastructure (SFTI); providing a high performance secure access network to customers and participants in the equities capital markets.    

Feedback

We are dedicated to remain New York's best Microsoft Azure Meetup Group - a high reaching goal that can only be achieved with our group members' input. If you have any suggestions on which topics you'd like to see covered, speakers you want to hear present or anything else you can think of, don't hesitate to <a>contact us</a>.

Please use our hashtag on Twitter to tweet about this user group: #NYCAZURE

Hope to see you there!

We will now be meeting every 3rd Wednesday of each month at 6pm.

If you have suggestions or are interested in presenting please e-mail us: [masked].
results.name: IT Transformation via Interconnection Oriented Architecture

results.description:
How To Use Recruiters, Ads, Social Media And Letter Campaigns To Your Best Advantage In Your Job Search

Everyone knows that networking is the most effective way to land a job. And yet we cannot or do not want to spend all our time networking. The best campaigns employ more than one method to succeed. Join career coach Win Sheffield to explore how to use many of the other tools available to a job seeker to best advantage.

You will learn:

How to manage relationships with recruitersThe most effective way to manage responding to adsDifferent social media strategies to get known in the job marketplaceDifferent kinds of letters and how to deploy them
results.name: How To Use Recruiters, Ads, Social Media- Your Best Advantage In Your Job Search

results.description:
Why attend?

We'll explore answers to the following questions:

• What are the current trends?

• How are retailers executing fulfillment profitably?

• What are the best practices?

• What research and analysis has been completed?

• What are the KPI's that retailers are measuring?

• Who within the retail organization is most interested and why?

• What areas within the supply chain are most impacted?

Who should attend?

Retailers looking for insight into omni-channel fulfillment best practices and networking opportunities. In the interests of keeping the discussion relevant, we ask that non-retailers bring a retailer.

Registration Required
Space is limited, so all attendees must register at: http://bridgesgi.com/omni-retail/

FEATURED PANELISTS

Joe Skorupa

Before becoming Editorial Director of RIS News, Joe was editor of Hospitality Technology, Consumer Goods Technology and VSR Magazine, all of which are media franchises of Edgell Communications, which Joe joined in 2001. In 2002, the American Business Press judged a series of columns Joe wrote to be one of the three best regularly featured columns in the country.


Joe is a frequently quoted interview source for national media, including USA Today, American Public Media, Washington Post and Investor’s Business Daily, as well as a speaker at such national conferences as the NRF Big Show.


Joe was formerly Editor-in-Chief of Boating World, Executive Editor of Boating, and outdoors editor for Popular Mechanics.


Jim Bengier

Jim is a seasoned executive with over 25 years of retail supply chain experience with expertise in omni-channel, forecasting, location management, and executing on the customer promise. He has an extremely diversified supply chain background that encompasses .com, specialty, discount, mass merchandise, and off-price retailing, and as the VP of Fulfillment for BestBuy.com, designed and implemented one of the earliest ‘buy online, pick up in-store’ processes, which is still in use today. Jim joined IBM in 2007 where his engagements included Abercrombie & Fitch, DSW and Ikea. Today he is Bridge Solutions Group’s Chief Customer Officer.


We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Panel Discussion: Achieving Profitable Omni-Channel Fulfillment

results.description:
Let's get coding! Our Hack Hours are a mix of boot camp and play ground, tech talk and hack hours. Come with your laptop, code, learn, hang out, have a drink, meet new people or just work on your project. 

For the most part we offer a space for hands-on coding, but for those interested we will have a brief 30 minutes tech talk to highlight one of the many technologies on the Bluemix platform, from Java, Node.js, MongoDB, Containers, Docker, Cloud Foundry, Big Data Analytics, Python, Java, Hadoop, Twilio, Pitney Bowes, Watson, IoT, MQTT, Mobile, Push Notifications, Continuous Integration and others.

AGENDA

6.00 sit down, go easy,

6.30 today's tech talk: Node.js with Node-Red (open source tool for browser based application work-flow editing)


7.00 hack away

9.00 wrapping up


Space is limited, but if demand exceeds space, I will try to facilitate the interest. So keep checking back. I do ask you to be considerate of space, and only sign up if you plan to attend. Feel free to ask questions or contact me.
results.name: Bluemix Hack Hours

results.description:
We are super stoked about this next Meetup being presented by our very own UX team! UX design, as a field, is constantly evolving for how we create solutions. There’s no greater example of that evolution than prototyping. A prototype is an early sample or mode of a product which is built to test a concept or process. Sometimes prototypes serve the purpose of replication or education about a product. When it comes to building great products, there's nothing better than going from idea to a prototype quickly to make sure your idea and designs are the right approach for your users.


For this Meetup, we will be getting our hands dirty and jumping right into the action. We’ll use Sketch to create mockups and InVision to create a prototype. This Meetup is about understanding how using these tools can allow you to create quality prototypes quickly and easily, without code, so you can get your ideas in front of a customer fast in order to gain valuable feedback. All this before a single line of code is written.


We can’t wait to finally have the chance for all our developers, designers, and operations team to come together and dive into this interactive design Meetup.

Just a few instructions for what to prepare before Wednesday night:  

1. Everyone must have a laptop.

2. Please download a free trial of Sketch 3 here. http://bohemiancoding.com/sketch

3. Please set up a personal “starter” InVision account here. https://projects.invisionapp.com/d/signup

Agenda: 

5:00 to 6:00 - 

Private employee meeting being held at IRHQ so please make sure not to show up till 6:00PM. 


6:00 to 6:05  -


Intro and Goals


6:05 to 6:15 -

Design background and present day

Design process @ InRhythm

Focus – Prototyping

Tools - setup to build

6:20 to 6:50

Intro to Sketch

Sketch exercise


7:00 to 7:30

Intro to InVision

InVision exercise


7:30 to 8:00

Closing remarks and hangout around the office!
results.name: How Prototyping is Essential for Building Successful Products

results.name: Wednesday Evening Tennis.

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

A relaxing 30 minutes to remove yourself from the busy outside world and find peace within. Re-energize yourself after a hectic week.


Meditation will allow you to relax your mind and return home energized and refreshed. They will provide you with new tools for dealing with stress, anxiety, and problems. They will also help you to overcome negative states of mind such as anger and jealousy, and to cultivate positive minds such as patience and love.

Meditation will be held at our temple filled with relaxing spiritual vibes.

It is held every week Tue. - Fri. all starting at 6:00 pm and anyone can attend!

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

group.name: Victory Pints: Board Games and Beer

results.description:
The continuing focus of Autodesk's 2016 products is ‘Workflow.' The integration of Revit Architecture, Structure & MEP into a single product called ‘Revit’ represents an enhanced environment where the designer can move seamlessly between tasks in the same workflow.

Autodesk Revit software is specifically built for Building Information Modeling (BIM), empowering design and construction professionals to bring ideas from concept to construction with a coordinated and consistent model-based approach. Autodesk Revit is a single application that includes features for architectural design, MEP and structural engineering, and construction.

Our topic will be presented by Roger Liucci, a BIM and 3D Printing Specialist at Microsol Resources. He provides instruction as well as technical support, network administration and BIM/CADD manager consultation, and is also heading up the 3D Printing Department at Microsol Resources. For the past 15 years at Microsol Resources, he has provided BIM implementation, support,  training and 3D Printing Services to our clients.

Roger is particularly interested the interaction between design and technology innovation as it relates to digital fabrication, He has given talks on building information modeling and technology innovation at Autodesk University, Design on the Delaware, and the Revit User Group.

Microsol Resources has been delivering integrated solutions to the architecture, engineering and construction industries for 27 years. It is a recognized leader in BIM technology solutions, as well as an Autodesk Platinum Partner with offices in New York, Boston and Philadelphia. Microsol Resources has been named Autodesk Partner of the Year in 2014.

Can't attend in person?


Please register for What's New in Revit 2016 on Aug 19,[masked]:00 PM EDT at:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/6538993931077769729
results.name: What's New in Revit 2016
