results.description: We are currently trying to build up enough of a player base for wedsndays so that we can keep this time slot open for Tabletop social gaming. Our members play a wide variety of games ranging from Fantasy Flight's conquest to Warhammer40k.  You tell us what games you play and we will let you know if we have a following for it.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a hanging banner saying "Nu Brand Gaming"
results.name: We currently host a variety of Tabletop strategy games.

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: New & Existing Member Social Networking & Welcome Party--Free Event

results.description:
Join us in our summer science fiction screening with 4 amazing shorts some screened at the Philip K Dick Festival.
Each one of these shorts from all over the world brings a stores chock full of intrigue , conspiracy and paranoia, all key ingredients in a PKD movie. Admission is 6 dollars
Here is synopsis of each!!
Roar (13m, Canada)
dir. by Stuart Langfield, Dylan Rekert
sub. by Jesse Savath Logline
Roar is about people with extraordinary powers; powers they spend their lives battling to control, and which ultimately consume them


Sleepworking (15m, United Kingdom)
dir. by Gavin Williams
sub. by Gavin Williams on[masked]:52
In the near future a young woman becomes a sleepworker: her body is programmed to do menial labour while she is asleep. However, she starts to suffer disturbing side effects and embarks upon a dangerous journey to uncover what sleepworkers are really being made to do while unconscious.. Albino (14m, Argentina)
dir. by Federico Telerman
sub. by Natalia Cortesi on[masked]:30 In a society where albino people are persecuted because of the characteristics of their blood, a group of rebels will rise in arms.


Frontier (16m, U S A)
dir. by Stephen Parkhurst
sub. by Stephen Parkhurst on[masked]:24
Shorts Competition A journalist travels deep into the north woods to investigate a mysterious government facility that's being built there. She interviews a local conspiracy theorist who's convinced the facility is a front for a sinister secret project. The man appears crazy, until some compelling evidence begins to surface.
results.name: Summer Sci Fi screening at Anthology Film Archives!!!

group.name: Philip K Dick,speculative sci-fi & New York Sci-Fi Festival

results.description:
Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. MINY Toastmasters is proud to be one of the 14,650 clubs in 126 countries that make up Toastmasters International Global network of meeting locations.

MINY Toastmasters provide a supportive and positive learning experience in which members are empowered to develop their communication and leadership skills, resulting in greater self-confidence and personal growth. By regularly giving speeches, gaining feedback, leading teams and guiding others to achieve their goals in a supportive atmosphere, leaders emerge from the Toastmasters program. Our goal at MINY Toastmasters is to empower individuals to become more effective communicators and leaders.
results.name: MINY Toastmasters Meetup

results.description:
Hey all!

Please come join us at our Summer Jam Session!  Take the time to play some music with your fellow music teachers and musicians.  We'll be focusing on simple songs we all know and love, to help develop our musical skills!

We'll have our full NYU backline available, which includes some electric guitars, basses, drum set and acoustics as well, so come on down and make some music!

Also... in classic Amp Up NYC tradition, there will be pizza!
results.how_to_find_us: Room 1102
results.name: Amp Up Jam Session!

results.description:
Fresh & company 58 East 8th St

Please note the link for Kojeve shown here worked As of February 10, 2015.


Please note that we are going to meet at the usual place but will adjourn to test a new salad place, Fresh & Company, 58 East 8th Street,  across the street when we get together.

We are accommodating members who are joining late with reviews as needed of previous material We took a look at Sense Certainty last week. Suggest a review of Perception for the next meeting.

We should refer as always to the appropriate Bernstein tapes. Finally, in the Introduction to the Reading of Hegel: Lectures on the Phenomenology of Spirit by Alexandre Kojève, Raymond Queneau, Allan Bloom and James H. Nichols (Oct 31, 1980) we should read Chapter 5.


Note new resource:

Kojeve available used on Amazon for $9.94 plus shipping or free online PDF at: http://www.scribd.com/doc/36163876/Alexandre-Kojeve-Introduction-to-the-Reading-of-Hegel

Included here for review is the glossary available online:

http://www.london.ac.uk/fileadmin/documents/students/philosophy/ba_course_materials/ba_19thc_hegel_glossary_01.pdf


For those new to the group we are delighted that you are joining us. Please review the beginning of the Hegel text: A. Consciousness, I. Sense certainty with attention to Hegel's process and derivation of the universal.
results.how_to_find_us: Please note that we are going to meet at the usual place but will adjourn to test a new salad place, Fresh & Company, 58 East 8th Street,  across the street when we get together.
results.name: Discuss Hegel's Phenomenology of Spirit, Sec. 658-698, Chapter 5 in the Kojeve

results.description:
This is the crash course where Glass Shack Film School instructors will introduce the world of indie web series making, with dozens of tips, in this two evening workshop.

This powerful and information-packed day will give you the tools you need to establish yourself as a screenwriter, director, and web series maker. Divided into four parts, this course starts at the very beginning with Writing the Screenplay and then explains the processes, tools and jobs of actually Making the Web Series.

This one day film school class is for anyone wanting to get to know the film industry, whether they have previous experience or not.

Schedule:
Wed, Aug 19: 6:00pm - 09:00pm
Thu, Aug 20: 6:00pm - 09:00pm

WHO: Narrative/Documentary Filmmakers
FEE: $199 Includes Studio and Equipment

Use the "meetup" coupon code for a $50 discount.

LIMITED SEATING. Join us! Learn how to create your Web Series

Register Here:

http://glassshackfilms.com/class-workshop/how-to-create-a-web-series-workshop/


Glass Shack Films
394 Broadway
5th Floor,
New York, NY 10013
Ph: (917)[masked] 

zoe (at) glassshackfilms (dot) com

results.description:
The 70s was arguably the most productive period for Classic Rock.

Bands like Led Zeppelin, Santana, Pink Floyd & The Allman Brothers, that first released albums in the 60s, produced some of their finest music during this decade which also gave birth to bands like Blondie the Police & the Cars that would go on to even greater fame during the 80s.

It was the decade of Dark Side of the Moon, Zepplin IV, Thick as a Brick & Abraxas so join us as we celebrate the music of the 70s!

It will feature:

The best classic rock the 70s had to offer!

70's classic rock related films & videos! 

70s trivia questions!

***Feel free to dress your 70s best but dressing up is NOT required!***

Drink specials:

$4 Genesse & Coors Original!

$6 Well Drinks!

$6 Purple Haze! 

$7 House Wine!

Food Specials:

$5 Chips & Guacamole!

$4 Hot Dogs!

***FREE ADMISSION!***

Date: Wednesday, August, 19th from 6-11PM.

Location: Pinks (242 East 10th street (Near 1st Ave.)

For further Info:

[masked] OR [masked]

See you there!

Andy
results.name: 70s Party @ Pinks Featuring its Music & Fashion: Free Admission!

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 4:00PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

results.description:
SpaceVR: We have all dreamed of the stars. Imagine being able to float through the space station, experience a space walk, or even explore the Moon and Mars. Our goal at SpaceVR is to bring space exploration within reach of everyone. We are sending a 360-degree camera to the International Space Station (ISS) to collect footage that anyone can experience using virtual reality headsets. With SpaceVR, now anyone can be an astronaut!


Cerevrum: is an entirely new approach to cognitive improvement, built from the ground up for VR. We combine virtual reality, cognitive neuroscience, and data-driven machine learning in an approach we call Neurogaming. Brain training's been around for a long time, but it's never been particularly fun and research shows that it doesn't lead to real-world benefits. At Cerevrum we want to solve these problems by integrating cognitive demands into games that are actually fun to play and using VR to engage the same cognitive skills we use in everyday life. Proprietary machine learning algorithms tailor game difficulty to the cognitive skills of each player, ensuring consistent challenge. Long story short, we want to make VR games so fun you'll forget they're making you smarter. As always, please bring your VR demos and your rigs to share VR with the community.


EEVO has one mission: to provide you the best virtual reality experiences. We work closely with top content creators to bring rich, engaging cinematic experiences to our platform. With EEVO, you can stream brilliant VR content in one spot.


DJ Smith: NYVR co-organizer and VR developer will be giving a brief overview on the social VR applications and experiences currently available and how to get involved.

Please let us know if you have a start up, project, or area of expertise that you would like to present at one of our events.  We would love to hear from you.


Please be advised that by attending any NY VR event and / or trying out any VR technology demo, you are indicating your agreement to the terms of the NY VR Waiver and Release of Liability Form, which can be found HERE
results.name: August NYVR Meetup - WEDNESDAY MEETUP

results.description:
In this meetup, LifeLabs New York leadership trainer Tania Luna will offer a behind-the-scenes look at how management training programs look at tech companies. Get a quick taste of a manager workshop and find out:


- How to set and communicate management standards
- The most effective training formats (including learning approaches and cadence)
- Techniques for increasing learning retention (aka stickiness)
- The training areas that make the biggest impact on new managers
- How companies decide whether to offer training internally or partner with external vendors
- How to measure manager effectiveness

Tania Luna is a trainer at LifeLabs New York. LifeLabs helps rapid-growth tech companies (like Etsy, Warby Parker, Tumblr, and Squarespace) scale their skills and culture. Tania specializes is in organizational psychology, emotion regulation, and surprise psychology. She is a researcher, TED speaker, and co-author of the new book Surprise: Embrace the Unpredictable and Engineer the Unexpected.
results.name: Demystifying Manager Training

I think last time most people took the G or the F to Carroll Street.  If you exit that station toward the front of the train, it puts you on Smith/3rd Streets. Make a left on 3rd, walk up two long blocks just over the bridge, and Whole Foods is on the right (they also have a parking lot). The Roof is upstairs (obviously) on the South side of the store, towards the canal.  If you go in the entrace there, the stairs going up are right there.

Hope to see you in Brooklyn!

Cheers,

Bill

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description: Nigeria is Africa’s largest and the world’s 20th largest economy. Rich in high-quality oil and other minerals, approximately 70% of Nigeria’s 181 million people live in poverty. The sharing of wealth is a result of the provision of special privileges and subtle monopolies over land and its resources to a favored few. Gordon Abiama details the causes of inequality in Nigeria and discusses practical steps to bring about a more equitable sharing of the nation’s wealth. Journalist Gordon Abiama is based in Bayelsa State, Nigeria. He is the Director of Africa Center for Geoclassical Economics, a non-governmental organization that is dedicated to sustainable development practices. Mr. Abiama is also a Member of the World Council on Renewable Energy (WCRE).
results.name: Nigeria – “the Giant of Africa” – Rich in Oil, Beset by Poverty

group.name: Progress and Prosperity, Land and Liberty – New York City

results.description:
At the last meetup, some great questions came up about how to test conditional independence using conditional mutual information. That raises the question "can you test the conditional independence relationships and build a graphical model from a dataset?" It's a hard problem in general, but we'll look at some approaches!

We'll play with conditional mutual information and other independence tests, and play with some model inference packages to see how they do on some toy datasets.

I'll post some references in the comments. Here's a good starting place!
http://www.phil.cmu.edu/tetrad/current.html
and
http://www.phil.cmu.edu/tetrad/publications.html


***Important*** : If your last name isn't visible through your group profile, or you didn't fill out the question when you RSVP'd, email it to me at adam.kelleher at buzzfeed dot com -- I'll need to put your name on the list for security. You won't be able to get inside if I don't have it! If you're not sure, err on the side of emailing! Be sure to bring ID.

Be sure to show up on time! You'll be able to come in between 6:15 and 6:45. Unfortunately, you'll likely have trouble getting past security if you're late.

Other notes about the group: This group is for anyone who wants to learn math! The philosophy is that you can apply an algorithm or analysis method best when you understand the theory behind it. Hence, we have a strong focus on theory, but with an eye toward application. We're an extremely informal group. While many of us are professionals in quantitative fields, none of us are necessarily experts in the topics we're covering. The hope is that we can all learn from both reading and group discussion.
results.name: Building Graphical Models From Data

results.description:
NYC Data Science Academy is offering a new course focus on Intensive Data Science Toolkit(Linux, Git, Sql)  to help Data Scientists and Business Analysts' work more productive and effective!

18 Seats only!  Register the classes from Eventbrite!

Dates & Hours

Aug 10, 12, 17, 19, 24, 26(Monday - Wed) , 6:30-9:30pm 

What is this class about?

This class is about the basic tools to work in a Unix setting. It includes:

Aug 10 and 12: Typical usage of git, a version control system, and online version github

Aug 17 and 19: Common shell command to achieve daily tasks, include filesystem, job management, standard IO and pipe

Aug 24: In-depth usage of vi and markdown SQL database access(1 night) 

Aug 26: Advanced Unix usage -- Grep, Sed, Awk, Csvkit(1 night)

Why take this class?

Unix environment is widely used in data science field. So be familiar with the common tools is required to carry out further data analysis. This class enables students to communicate with computer via command line environment. And it also introduce the SQL database, which is the traditional database widely used in the enterprise setting.

Expected Learning Outcomes

After successful completion of this course, you will be able to:

Linux 

• Comfortable with Linux environment 

• Able to use Linux commands 

• Familiar with IO redirection and Pipe 

• Able to connect and work from remote server 

Git 

• Adopt to modern source code management 

• Able to use common git operations 

• Able to setup github and create personal portfolio page

SQL 

• Able to build relational database for data storage 

• Able to access relational database and query for data

Course Logistics

Prerequisites

Basic knowledge of computer components. Basic knowledge of internet

Recommended Materials

Linux command line

git book 

Online Discussion Platforms

Piazza is our online class room. All class content and schedule will be posted there.

Course Components

Lectures

18 hours lectures

Homework

There are three main homework assignments:

1. git & github 

2. SQL 

3. Create personal setting on Unix server

Course Policies

Assessment Procedure

Course performance will be evaluated on a pass/fail basis based on completion of homework. Homework assignments will be handed out in class along with due dates.

Students will gain a certificate upon successful completion of this course.
results.name: Unix Introduction workshop day 2(two days intensive)

results.description:
Hi Nodesters! We've got a feature talk this month!

Feature Talk - Travis Kaufman - Dead-simple Async Control Flow with Coroutines

Coroutines are extremely powerful constructs that make writing asynchronous code dead simple. In this talk, we'll go over how we can implement coroutines in ES6 using generators and promises, as well as tools and libraries that allow you to leverage coroutines today. We'll also walk through some sample use cases that showcase the power of coroutines.

Lightning Talk - Jimmy Farrell - Downstream and Upstream Request Flow with the Koa Web Framework

Express.js has become the default Node.js web application framework. But that doesn’t mean it is the only technology that developers can use, nor is it always the best solution for Node developers. Koa, started in 2013, is a lightweight web application framework that is unique in its use of ES6 generators in its architecture. This talk will give a brief introduction to Koa as an alternative to Express. 

Lightning Talk - Eddie Zaneski - A Glance at the ES6 Tooling of Today

Even though the ECMAScript 2015 (ES6) specification was recently finalized, it will be a while before there is widespread browser adoption. The community has developed some pretty awesome tools to get the JavaScript oftomorrow running today. We'll take a quick look at Babel, Webpack, and JSPM to get up and running.

***Note on security***: As always, please ensure your full name is listed on your Meetup profile, if you RSVP yes to join. Building security will need it to grant you access to the event.


Thanks to Shutterstock for hosting! It's going to be a great event! See you there!

- Matt
results.name: Dead-simple Async Control Flow with Coroutines, Koa and More~

RSVP THROUGH NYCDA HERE


Agenda: 

6:30pm – 7:00pm: Networking and everyone getting seated

7:00pm – 7:45pm: Moderator/Panel Discussion

7:45pm – 8:00pm: Open Q&A and Audience Interaction

8:00pm – 8:30pm: Announcements and Networking


What: Who Owns Innovation At A Company?

Most would agree that innovation is everyone's responsibility, but employees can't innovate unless their leaders empower them to do so. Innovation needs a champion within the organization to push them to take calculated risks, and to step outside their own comfort zone. Without ownership, positive results are almost impossible to achieve. So, who is that person within a company?


Moderator:  Linda Woodfield-Stern, VP, HR Global Product & Technology at ADP

Linda is the VP HR, Global Product & Technology for ADP and spearheads talent acquisition for ADP Innovation Lab.  She is responsible for human capital & talent strategy development and execution for global product & technology organization with over 7500 associates across 20+ countries worldwide.



Panelists:  

Anna Carsen, VP of Product Management at ADP

Anna is an industry thought leader for Mobile HR Solutions and is currently leading ADP’s Mobile Strategy.  She is also responsible for a product portfolio that includes ADP’s new Revolution user experience, platform as a service and  Identity Management.  Anna has over 16 years product management experience across both the Human Capital Management domain and enabling technologies.  She is passionate about innovation, design and creating break-through HR solutions.

Mona Patel, CEO at Motivate Design

Mona is the CEO & Founder of Motivate Design, a UX-led agency based in New York City. Motivate Design helps clients discover customer needs and design solutions that meet those needs. Through her experience, Mona developed the Reframework, an 8-step process that any company can use. She recently released an Amazon Bestseller, Reframe: Shift the way you work, innovate and think, that demonstrates how this process can help companies innovate and design simple, beautiful experiences. In addition to helping clients and other Fortune 500 companies feel unstuck, Mona is also a teacher at Parsons the New School for Design.

Jennifer Thibault, Innovation Strategist at 18F


Jennifer Thibault is a brand strategist, designer, and creative services manager. She balances form with function, but always leads with curiosity and heart. Jennifer has led design teams on projects spanning a variety of clients and media. She consistently focuses on designing clear, compelling, and impactful communications that express complex ideas. Most recently, Jennifer established and managed the creative team at Reboot, an international development and social impact consultancy. While at Reboot, she led a comprehensive repositioning of the company brand. She also directed creative services and design strategy for clients spanning governments, foundations, international organizations, and nonprofits.


Samantha Trinh, Director, Product Strategy at Cablevision

Samantha consults with brands, agencies and high growth companies domestically and abroad, with a track record of innovation in leading high performing teams, developing product/service enhancements, early stage ventures and management from market entry to scale. She works with startups and Fortune 500 companies to launch industry leading products and brands, and supports impact driven organizations in the startup ecosystem. In her current role at Cablevision (CVC), one of the nation’s leading media and telecommunications companies serving millions of homes and businesses in the New York metropolitan area, she supports advanced advertising product development efforts and strategic initiatives in collaboration with marketing and business development teams to reach regional and national advertisers.


Sara Holoubek, CEO at Luminary Labs

Sara Holoubek is the CEO and founder of Luminary Labs, a consultancy focused on operationalizing innovation. Her firm develops strategies and innovation systems for Fortune 500 and government leaders seeking to transform their organizations and industries. Ms. Holoubek has been widely quoted in publications such as Fast Company, The Washington Post and WSJ.com. She has been recognized as a female founder to watch in Mashable, and her company has been profiled in business books, The Big Enough Company and Stiletto Network.  She also serves as a frequent guest lecturer on the subjects of technology and innovation. Ms. Holoubek is also an active adviser and investor. She has served on the inaugural Pioneer Advisory Group for the Robert Wood Johnson Pioneer Fund, and founded Luminary Labs Ventures, which invests in early stage companies.
results.name: Suggested Event: Who Owns Innovation At a Company?

A few years ago, Facebook realized it could make building things easier by fiddling with the programming languages Facebook engineers use. In this talk Gabe will explain how a company like Facebook leverages PL to move faster, what Hack (http://hacklang.org/) and Flow (http://flowtype.org/) are, how Facebook transitions it's codebases to Hack and Flow, and how Facebook uses OCaml to build fast, scalable typecheckers.

Speaker: Gabe Levi has worked at Facebook since graduating from Carnegie Mellon University in 2010. Before working on programming language projects like Flow and Hack, he worked on Facebook's news feed, notifications, platform, and product infrastructure.

Food and venue kindly provided by our sponsor, Jane Street.

As always, we'll walk over to one of the bars on Stone Street after the talk.
results.name: OCaml at Facebook

8:00pm – 8:30pm: Announcements and Networking


What: "Who owns innovation at a company?"

Most would agree that innovation is everyone's responsibility, but employees can't innovate unless their leaders empower them to do so. Innovation needs a champion within the organization to push them to take calculated risks, and to step outside their own comfort zone. Without ownership, positive results are almost impossible to achieve. So, who is that person within a company?


Moderator:   Linda Woodfield-Stern, VP, HR Global Product & Technology at ADP

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/Q_Rr_Sx31ftj6fObZtcDGlrx1SzVaX00LMVmdPwA4hkXUprl1oUlaemOQY9oDEMUDOCpiu2nzqkL2RT4swBbMnhe4TwrTNPobamf56sWlUCnuIkzSbqPPH6jvd0ig17X4r79E4o

Linda is the VP HR, Global Product & Technology for ADP and spearheads talent acquisition for ADP Innovation Lab.  She is responsible for human capital & talent strategy development and execution for global product & technology organization with over 7500 associates across 20+ countries worldwide.

Panelists:  

Anna Carsen, VP of Product Management at ADP

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/1Z_aVh68Tt9bHhEdgtU_NKd-MRwrG8aMy37_L4aPXVX7PKoKDcDcCcB_i1LVDgjdi-ogaJ-ZYbKQ3u57Z5IykLNSQv4Xym48tnZECD4PSmYd53KnldiBm8s2N4lfmaSbVlxqals

Anna is an industry thought leader for Mobile HR Solutions and is currently leading ADP’s Mobile Strategy.  She is also responsible for a product portfolio that includes ADP’s new Revolution user experience, platform as a service and  Identity Management.  Anna has over 16 years product management experience across both the Human Capital Management domain and enabling technologies.  She is passionate about innovation, design and creating break-through HR solutions.

Mona Patel, CEO at Motivate Design

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/zmu1XmkvkyE6etZxWUDqiBaVSYUCwyWPqufuS7V2eP67IetPT32wDMl6fmIU2YfdAtW2iVTI2VRvbUoYFOauaNcZs5eUynuOJ3aweHxpzqyx2KLD9hghsOOiTuYKe_i299B-QLA

Mona is the CEO & Founder of Motivate Design, a UX-led agency based in New York City. Motivate Design helps clients discover customer needs and design solutions that meet those needs. Through her experience, Mona developed the Reframework, an 8-step process that any company can use. She recently released an Amazon Bestseller, Reframe: Shift the way you work, innovate and think, that demonstrates how this process can help companies innovate and design simple, beautiful experiences. In addition to helping clients and other Fortune 500 companies feel unstuck, Mona is also a teacher at Parsons the New School for Design.

Jennifer Thibault, Innovation Strategist at 18F

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/IHbw4Re8rVHRF_NrJ4pGXfYo8mV3biy6MBDYwET8e-wJ0eExV39AYuAChUdukBJsKG-NOSqmfB020YewDwtOVhIfpbo1U_G01Tv4NxHOLGjHS5Ejzv2b4ods3ohAPUBXco1PF3g

Jennifer Thibault is a brand strategist, designer, and creative services manager. She balances form with function, but always leads with curiosity and heart. Jennifer has led design teams on projects spanning a variety of clients and media. She consistently focuses on designing clear, compelling, and impactful communications that express complex ideas. Most recently, Jennifer established and managed the creative team at Reboot, an international development and social impact consultancy. While at Reboot, she led a comprehensive repositioning of the company brand. She also directed creative services and design strategy for clients spanning governments, foundations, international organizations, and nonprofits.

Sara Holoubek, CEO at Luminary Labs

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/1hQ2DUuyNLoFEzcya3myALLNrVmbSJ8a2_x-HFWXLbX7RjLZDje6G-lcsM0Zowt0uXte-Van6iwh2EXg68ycnMaKd5_rzWDCXw62RaQ-TW6F_Igu0Wv3_0MoYXFa9HsBusIVros

Sara Holoubek is the CEO and founder of Luminary Labs, a consultancy focused on operationalizing innovation. Her firm develops strategies and innovation systems for Fortune 500 and government leaders seeking to transform their organizations and industries. Ms. Holoubek has been widely quoted in publications such as Fast Company, The Washington Post and WSJ.com. She has been recognized as a female founder to watch in Mashable, and her company has been profiled in business books, The Big Enough Company and Stiletto Network.  She also serves as a frequent guest lecturer on the subjects of technology and innovation. Ms. Holoubek is also an active adviser and investor. She has served on the inaugural Pioneer Advisory Group for the Robert Wood Johnson Pioneer Fund, and founded Luminary Labs Ventures, which invests in early stage companies.

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Mental Poisoning by H. Spencer Lewis.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 1 Hypnotism or Black Magic.

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

Tortured souls. Human beings, whose self-confidence and peace of mind have been torn to shreds by invisible darts—the evil thoughts of others. Can envy, hate, and jealousy be projected through space from the mind of another? Do poisoned thoughts like mysterious rays reach through the ethereal realm to claim innocent victims? Will wishes and commands born in hate gather momentum and like an avalanche descend upon a helpless man or woman in a series of calamities? Must humanity remain at the mercy of evil influences created in the minds of the vicious? Millions each year are mentally poisoned—are you safe from this scourge? Mental Poisoning is the title of a book written by Dr. H. Spencer Lewis, which fearlessly discloses this psychological problem.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Mental Poisoning: Hypnotism or Black Magic.

results.description:
This month, let's continue with our rotating group of discussion leaders who will suggest topics and lead the group for a particular month. Thanks again to Susan for leading  a great discussion last time, and this month, Stuart will lead on the broad theme of "current events/history." Here are some specific topics (as usual, we'll vote for one at the meetup):

1.  What was the most defining event or pivotal moment of the 20th century (i.e., Moon landing, JFK assassination, MLK assassination, manufacture of the personal computer, etc.)               

2. What historical figures have inspired you?                        

3.  How much can we really learn about candidates by watching and listening to the presidential debates?                        

4.  Has the "what's trending" mentality of the media shortened our attention spans and impaired our ability to think deeply about issues?    

As usual, looking forward to a great discussion!

A $3 contribution to cover Meetup fees would be appreciated!

results.description:
CONEY ISLAND BEACH YOGA by donation (suggested donation $10)

WEDNESDAYS IN AUGUST, weather permitting
7:00-8:00 pm 

Come join me as we practice yoga to the sound of the waves! We will practice on the beach in Coney Island off West 19th Street.  This is an open-level yoga class, designed to accommodate beginners to advanced practitioners.

Please plan on meeting at 6:45 pm at Lola Star Shop in the Stillwell Av subway station.  (When you're exiting from the turnstiles, take the Surf Av exit. Walk through the corridor lined with shops.  Lola Star is the last shop on your left before you get to the street called Surf Av. The shop is across from the Dunkin Donuts. **We do NOT meet at the Lola Star Shop on the boardwalk.) They have a limited amount of yoga mats that you can use for free. It is strongly suggested, however, that you bring your own mat. At 6:50, we will walk together to the beach.  If you are later than 6:50, come find us right on the beach by walking along the boardwalk to West 19th St. (When you get on the boardwalk, turn right towards the baseball stadium and Parachute jump, in the opposite direction of the Aquarium. We will be somewhere on the sand close to the water, off the boardwalk, across from the Abe Stark Sports Center.)  ** If you cannot find us, call me up to 7 pm [masked])

SUBWAYS: D, Q, F, N trains to Coney Island

For more info, contact the instructor, Chia-Ti, by phone:[masked] email: [masked] or Lola Surf Shop (www.lolastar.com).

About Donation-based classes: Donation classes are an affordable option to practice yoga. They are not free classes.  If you would like to take a free class, I teach a Thursday night free class in Manhattan.  (For more information about those classes, visit my meetup group: http://www.meetup.com/Free-and-Affordable-Yoga-Meditation-African-Dance-Classes/)  The suggested donation for this Coney Island class is $10.  Of course, pay what you can.  Your generosity is appreciated to help sustain community classes.  

About Chia-Ti: I am a yoga teacher and Thai bodyworker. I have been teaching yoga for over 13 years. This is my third year teaching this donation-based yoga class in Coney Island. I love that we get to watch the sunset after class, and to teach on the beach in my borough! I teach yoga to adults, elders, and incarcerated teens. I believe yoga is a privilege that should be accessible and affordable to all who wish to practice. For more information about the services I offer, please visit my website: www.onelovewellness.com
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at Lola Star Surf Shop or on the beach itself!

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

During the month of August, in addition to mindfulness, we'll explore lovingkindness meditation. 

(Totally optional, and you do not have to read the book to participate in the meetings this month, but if you'd like to learn more, check out Sharon Salzberg's book, Lovingkindness: The Revolutionary Art of Happiness. For more on lovingkindness practice, check out IDP'S Metta Month resources.)



Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to support the teachers, the Astoria Bookshop, and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
Pierre will talk about how to model churn in today companies. Churn rate is a measure of client retention and is closely related to customer lifetime value. Being able to predict churn helps companies improove their customer retention. Pierre will focus on how to properly define churn (not always trivial), what tables to maintain and how the whole prediction part would work in a production environment. Most of the examples / data will be taken from ebusiness companies though a similar logic can apply for other business.  

Bio :

Pierre Gutierrez is a senior Data Scientist at Dataiku (www.dataiku.com). He has experience in several topics such as fraud detection, predictive maintenance, recommender systems, smart cities or churn prediction. Pierre likes to apply Data Science tools for real world problems. Dataiku edits Data Science Studio (DSS) , a collaborative development platform for data professionals. The product integrates standard data and machine learning tools and technologies, allowing users to build their own data-driven projects.

There will be Pizza and Beer before we start (6:30PM). BlackLabelRobot will also give NYC Warp Zone maps (like the one in our meetup banner) for free and a special edition MAD Mobile.
results.name: How to data model Churn (real life examples)

results.description:
EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC
results.how_to_find_us: Go to front desk and ask where the downstairs stairwell is to the open mic.
results.name: Wednesday Night Open Mic @ Q4 Hotel - Music, Poetry, Comedy, Spoken Word

group.name: The Inspired Word NYC Open Mic - Poetry, Music, Comedy

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Whether it’s in a cockpit at takeoff or the planning of an offensive war, a romantic relationship or a dispute at the office, there are many opportunities to lie and self-deceive — but deceit and self-deception carry the costs of being alienated from reality and can lead to disaster. So why does deception play such a prominent role in our everyday lives? In his bold new work, Rutgers University evolutionary theorist Robert Trivers unflinchingly argues that self-deception evolved in the service of deceit—the better to fool others. We do it for biological reasons—in order to help us survive and procreate. From viruses mimicking host behavior  to humans misremembering (sometimes intentionally) the details of a quarrel, science has proven that the deceptive one can always outwit the masses. But we undertake this deception at our own peril. 

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE.

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD - "The Folly of Fools"

results.description:
If you are a screenwriter, this is the meetup you should not miss every month. The Black in Television and Film Collective (BTFC) writers committee is off and running. The first step is to come and connect with, be inspired by and challenged by other great writers.

In past committee meetings, we have spoken with Reggie Bythewood, Michael Starburry and Devanshi Patel. We will also table read current work from committee screenwriters.

If you are a writer, the writers committee is a great resource!
results.name: The Collective Writer's Committee

group.name: The Black TV and Film Collective

results.description:
To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

Session 1 (7pm-8pm): Interpretation methods practice

For example, words, phrases or sentences interpretation, target language repeating, shadowing and summarization, etc.

We set two tables to practice Chinese and Korean separately (Japanese is on hiatus due to low membership). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese and Korean learners.

Session 2 (8pm-9pm): Topic-based speaking practice

Summary, speak or discuss the topic you are provided or you have prepared by your target language (Chinese & Korean).

Also, everybody can move to any table as they want.

If you would like to practice English, please join our regular Saturday meetup generously hosted by Carl.

Looking forward to practicing with you all!

Organizers
results.name: Regular Interpretation & Speaking CJK Practice

group.name: Chinese, Japanese and Korean in Practice (Non-beginners)

venue.name: Bread & Butter at 29 St. and Park Ave. Manhattan, Upstairs

results.description:
Truth is at best partial, at worst error. We are at best explorers, at worst believers. If we desire to fully grow we must keep exploring. . . Welcome Explorers! (And curious believers too!)

This is a group for exploring and testing each other's new ideas, and for the potential of creating even more together!

As a starting point we'll discuss the possibility of:

A natural morality based on our passion's values;

A politics that roots out resentment so we can enjoy

a unified diversity;

And a culture of 7 billion honest individuals---

with not one truth!

 

This morality, politics, and culture have one goal: That we each flourish--that we each fully bloom into all that we are--together.

 

Can it happen? Should it happen? What do you propose? Let's talk about it!

 

 

Note: Ripple Effect Photo by Segiu Bacioiu.
results.how_to_find_us: 29th St. & Park Avenue, Manhattan
results.name: The Arc of Becoming: Does your life-span's arc stop when you die?

group.name: Exploring New Ideas in Morality, Politics, and Culture NYC

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, August 5th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The August session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (August 4th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.
results.name: Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino Classes!

Monthly happy hours continues. Let me meet & get to know few more Asian friends. Skiers and snowboarders from ski group are also invited. We will have the entire right side (after getting off elevator) to our group so you won't miss it.

Check out the website: http://muinyc.com/


21+ ONLY with government issued ID

This is a combined event with my other groups - NYC Young Asian Fun Group and NY Ski & Snowboard Club

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-9pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 12 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 7-9pm ($10)

Soldering Wednesday is the perfect open event if you don't have a project - drop by, pick up a kit, and make something cool with our members at your side.

No obligation to buy a kit - bring your own project and hack with the MakerBar community.

Current kit menu:

The TV-B-Gone - A universal remote that turns off any television. ANY TV. Reduce distractions at the bar, cause havoc at Best Buy, and feel like a superhero. Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition developed by members! - $30 - 2 Hours - Medium Difficulty The Joule Thief - A super-bright flashlight that runs on dead batteries. WHAT?! Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition developed by members! - $10 - 1 Hour - Easy Difficulty The Sonic Pencil - A pencil that makes extraordinarily silly sounds as you draw. Great soldering and fun for kids and adults. Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition based on Drawdio open hardware! - $20 - 1.5 Hours - Easy Difficulty XProtolab - An entire electronics bench on a circuit smaller than most erasers. Snaps into a breadboard and features a dual-channel oscilloscope, logic analyzer, FFT, voltmeter... Dense surface-mount soldering with special components means you'll use special toys to build it! Expert solderers only. Yes, it actually works; you can try ours first. - $35 - 3 Hours - Extreme Difficulty Soldering Wednesday is open to the public and repeats on the third Wednesday of every month. The event is organized by Travis Jones.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]


MakerBar is a 503(c) NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive!


Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

results.description: San Piedro Island, north of Puget Sound, is a place so isolated that no one who lives there can afford to make enemies.  But in 1954 a local fisherman is found suspiciously drowned, and a Japanese American named Kabuo Miyamoto is charged with his murder.  In the course of the ensuing trial, it becomes clear that what is at stake is more than a man's guilt. For on San Pedro, memory grows as thickly as cedar trees and the fields of ripe strawberries--memories of a charmed love affair between a white boy and the Japanese girl who grew up to become Kabuo's wife; memories of land desired, paid for, and lost. Above all, San Piedro is haunted by the memory of what happened to its Japanese residents during World War II, when an entire community was sent into exile while its neighbors watched.  Gripping, tragic, and densely atmospheric, Snow Falling on Cedars is a masterpiece of suspense-- one that leaves us shaken and changed.

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

 

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

results.description:
Whether it’s in a cockpit at takeoff or the planning of an offensive war, a romantic relationship or a dispute at the office, there are many opportunities to lie and self-deceive — but deceit and self-deception carry the costs of being alienated from reality and can lead to disaster. So why does deception play such a prominent role in our everyday lives? In his bold new work, Rutgers University evolutionary theorist Robert Trivers unflinchingly argues that self-deception evolved in the service of deceit—the better to fool others. We do it for biological reasons—in order to help us survive and procreate. From viruses mimicking host behavior  to humans misremembering (sometimes intentionally) the details of a quarrel, science has proven that the deceptive one can always outwit the masses. But we undertake this deception at our own peril. 

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE.

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD - "The Folly of Fools"

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills!  This session is open to sketchers of all levels. 

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist. 

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Wednesday - Live Model Drawing - Union Square

During the evening we will go around the room and ask each people to respond to a question in what we call the" icebreaker" of the evening as a way of getting people used to speaking in front of a group. We will have someone give a speech that evening and then be evaluated by another member so you have a chance to see how we work on improving your communication skills. You don't have to bring anything to the meeting but yourself and you're welcome to bring a guest with you as either just company, or someone else who also might be interested in learning more about Toastmasters. The meetings less approximately an hour and we try to make the meetings lively and informative .

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.

results.description:
Have you ever wanted to create live maps for your website? Have you struggled with geospatial data, the headache of storing it, or the reliance on proprietary software to play with it? Have you heard of libraries and services like OSM, Leaflet, Mapbox, and Mapbox Studio, but never been sure how they interact with each other or what you can do with them? Have you seen slick webmaps online and longed to recreate them, or build dashboards that allow you to explore your geo-spatial information in interactive charts, maps, and graphs?

This is the workshop for you!


The workshop will cover:


• Mapping Basics: the different components of online maps, how they operate, the data they depend on, and an overview of some of the platforms that could be used to produce them (Google Maps, Mapbox, CartoDB)

• Mapping Data: how to find and prepare data for webmaps, free sources (data.gov, local data portals, OSM Overpass API), as well as how to create and transform data of your own (geojson.io, Fulcrum), and how to store it (Github, CartoDB)

• Creating Custom Maps:  Working with CartoDB, we'll walk through how to make maps fast in a GUI, how to how to style them with CartoCSS, and how to use JavaScript to extend their interactivity. You'll learn how to design, build, host, and dynamically update a map.

This will be part I of the course; part II (in a few weeks) will go over advanced JavaScript methods and PostgreSQL for dynamic maps.

Prerequisites:


This class presumes some basic familiarity with HTML/CSS and JavaScript; although we'll provide template files and instruction to minimize a dependency on this prerequisite. Curious to learn and interested in a short primer? Try out one of our Map Academy lessons online (like Codecademy but open source and for GIS)!

Don't forget to bring your own laptop and power supply, we'll provide the rest!

About the Instructors:

Aurelia is a scientist at CartoDB, she works on data visualization and curriculum development at CartoDB, and co-runs the Girl Develop It NYC chapter. You can check out the things she makes on Github or bl.ocks.

Andy is a scientist at CartoDB. He works on data analysis with the goal of helping everyone make smarter maps, and education development with Aurelia. He spends a lot of his free time hiking or dreaming of hiking.
results.how_to_find_us: Ring #2 at the door to get buzzed in, proceed to the second floor, look for the CartoDB sign and enter :)
results.name: Intro to Web Mapping + GIS

Who is ready to step up their workout routine, burn more calories, build more muscle and endurance and have a little fun with a great group of members who will help motivate you.  As an Instructor I will help you progress your fitness level after each workout.  This workout is suitable for all fitness levels. I will show you how to start out with modifications and work your way up to a more advanced level.  If you are a warrior and prefer the advance then this is for you!!! ALL LEVELS WILL BE DEMONSTRATED.  This is fun, it's challenging and you will feel GREAT by time you get through with your workout.  Please bring water, and a yoga mat and a positive attitude.  And get ready to WORK!

Now you can take a live Insanity class with Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta.


This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!

results.description:
FANTASTIC FICTION at KGB reading series, hosts Ellen Datlow and Matthew Kressel present:

The Fifth Season by N.K. Jemisin
N.K. Jemisin
N. K. Jemisin is a Brooklyn author whose short fiction and novels have been multiply nominated for the Hugo and Nebula awards, shortlisted for the Crawford and the Tiptree. The Hundred Thousand Kingdoms won the Locus Award for Best First Novel. Her speculative works range from fantasy to science fiction to the undefinable; her themes include resistance to oppression, the inseverability of the liminal, and the coolness of Stuff Blowing Up. Her sixth novel, The Fifth Season, will be out from Orbit Books this month.

&

The Ultra Fabulous Glitter Squadron Saves the World Again by A.C. Wise
A.C. Wise
A.C. Wise’s short fiction appears in Apex, Uncanny, Shimmer, and The Year’s Best Dark Fantasy and Horror: 2015. She also co-edits Unlikely Story. Her collection, The Ultra Fabulous Glitter Squadron Saves the World Again, will be published by Lethe Press in 2015.

Wednesday, August 19th, 2015, 7pm at

KGB Bar, 85 East 4th Street (just off 2nd Ave, upstairs.)
http://www.kgbfantasticfiction.org/

Subscribe to our mailing list:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/kgbfantasticfiction/

Readings are always free.

Please forward to friends at your own discretion.

results.description:
THIS IS A TICKETED EVENT.

Join us on August 19th for our next KSE Founder Series! Our special guest will be Jun S. Yoon, co-founder and CTO of Culinary Agents. If you're in the food, beverage, & hospitality industry, you're not going to want to miss this.


Early bird tickets are now available until August 16th.

PLEASE NOTE: You will need to purchase a ticket to attend this event.

Simply RSVP-ing "Yes" on meetup will NOT get you in. We will be checking for tickets at the event. Tickets can be purchased at https://ksefounderseries82015.splashthat.com/.

About Jun S. Yoon

Jun S. Yoon is currently a co-founder and Chief Technology Officer of Culinary Agents, the leading trusted professional networking community for the food, beverage & hospitality industry. Venture-backed Culinary Agents has clients in over 30+ cities and is trusted by over 4,500 businesses including more than 60% of the Michelin-starred restaurants in the US. The company will expand its professional service in Europe partnering with METRO AG, one of the biggest international retail companies specially in hospitality industry.

In 2008, Yoon co-Founded Image Space Media, an In-Image advertising company based in New York City with Raymond Chan (COO at Culinary Agents) and Kevin Tung (Venture Partner at Interplay Ventures). The VC-backed company was successfully acquired by Vibrant Media, the leaders in alternative contextual ad products, in 2012. With the acquisition, he became VP of Engineering for Vibrant Media and managed global (US and UK) engineering team.

Prior to Image Space Media, Yoon was a Lead Engineer at Inform Technologies, a venture-backed start-up where he led product development of semantic technology for premium content brands such as CNN and Washington Post.

Yoon has also been an active angel investor. He invested in several start-ups including healthcare, fashion and software & technology sectors.


TICKETS

Early Bird Tickets: $7.00 until 8/16/2015

Regular Tickets: $12.00 after 8/16/2015

*Light beverage and food will be provided.

For tickets visit: https://ksefounderseries82015.splashthat.com/

“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.
