results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: Weekly Climbing Meetup - New members climb for free!!

One of the most common questions I get from clients and students is about texting.

Let's go over some basic guidelines for texting, how to avoid mistakes over the phone, how soon to text her when you get her number, how to set up a date over text, etc, etc.

Depending on how busy the bar is, we can split up and socialize after the discussion.

See you there!

Justin

results.description:
#throwbackSUMMER is FULL ON at BFunk Naach Xpress! If I were you, I would want a blast to the past every once in a while. This week's choreography is to the song 'Hookah Bar'. Whoaaa... took you back right? No? what. WHY. No worries, we will change that when you come :)

What is Naach Xpress though? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it! Here's a sneak peek from a one of our classes:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J_SjOF-7b0k

Go follow us on Instagram as well (@bollywoodfunk)! Get updated on behind the scenes footage, updates, and tons of the BFunk family dose.

NAACH XPRESS runs WEDNESDAY from 8-9PM at Pearl Studios in NYC. Location: Pearl Studios: 500 8th Ave, 12th flr (btw 35th & 36th St), NYC

Rate: Try Naach Xpress for only $20 (for drop-in first class) and/or discount packages of 5 or 10 classes thereafter. Get ready to feel the joy and burn as you groove, sweat and dance your heart out...AND get a great workout!

Reserve your spot now:
Click on BFunk Naach Xpress (Valid for first lesson only) http://bollywoodfunknyc.com/General/new-york-city.html For more info and class packages:www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

results.description:
Please check the website 'every week' for updates. meditationinnewyork.org/williamsburg-meditation-buddhism

Weekly guided meditations and Buddhist teachings in Williamsburg are suitable for both beginners and more advanced meditation practitioners.  These classes offer meditation techniques and teachings on the fundamentals of Buddhism, with an emphasis on their practical application in everyday life.

Although these meditation classes are given as a series, they can also be taken individually. Please feel free to drop in on a class-by-class basis.

Classes are held every week unless otherwise stated.
No special clothing is required. No pre-registration required.

Everyone Welcome.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Hey everyone! We had another really great discussion in July...& our primarily male turnout definitely dispelled the myth that bookclubs are frequented only by women seeking chardonnay & gossip ; ) We're loving our new home at City Bistro too - private room & bartender + full menu = major upgrade!

For August we're re-reading a book the club did years ago that was a group fav...hope you enjoy it too!  As always, feel free to join us whether you finish he book or not - Julie

Wednesday August 19th - 8pm - City Bistro 2nd floor front room
The Shadow of the Wind by Carlos Ruiz Zafon

"A New York Times & international bestseller - Barcelona, 1945: A city slowly heals in the aftermath of the Spanish Civil War, and Daniel, an antiquarian book dealer’s son who mourns the loss of his mother, finds solace in a mysterious book entitled The Shadow of the Wind, by one Julián Carax. But when he sets out to find the author’s other works, he makes a shocking discovery: someone has been systematically destroying every copy of every book Carax has written. In fact, Daniel may have the last of Carax’s books in existence. Soon Daniel’s seemingly innocent quest opens a door into one of Barcelona’s darkest secrets--an epic story of murder, madness, and doomed love."

“ Anyone who enjoys novels that are scary, erotic, touching, tragic and thrilling should rush right out to the nearest bookstore and pick up The Shadow of the Wind. Really, you should.” --Michael Dirda, The Washington Post

"Wonderous... masterful... The Shadow of the Wind is ultimately a love letter to literature, intended for readers as passionate about storytelling as its young hero." --Entertainment Weekly (Editor's Choice)

"One gorgeous read." --Stephen King
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the front lounge on the 2nd floor in our fancy new digs ;)
results.name: August Bookclub

results.description:
Here is your chance to use an Amazing Telescope, for Free.!

Come view the universe through one of the premier telescopes in Northern New Jersey at the William D. McDowell Observatory in DeKorte Park in Lyndhurst. Saturn, Neptune and the stars Arcturus, Vega, and Albireo will be visible, weather permitting.

The state-of-the-art Observatory features a research-grade, Classical-Cassegrain telescope with a 22-inch mirror housed beneath a six-meter retractable dome. The telescope is capable of viewing objects millions of light years away. For more information on the William D. McDowell Observatory, please

visit <a>www.njmeadowlands.gov</a>.


Due to popular demand, Dr. John Sloan and I will be hosting a Astronomy session, and its Free! We will using the Observatory’s 20-inch, research-grade telescope, and we will be looking @(Uranus, Neptune, (Vega, Double-Double, Alberio, M13, M11, M57, M31.

We will "Meet Up" around 8:00

For a Free tour-

Then as soon as the Sun goes Down...

the Main Discussion will be by Dr. Sloan.

He will explain the wonders of the universe in this Astronomy” session. ( Group discussion.)- where participants can engage and look through the Telescope and ask questions....This is a beautiful new environmental facility.

(Weather permitting.)

Rain will be a problem. and (HEAVY CLOUDS)

WE need Clear Skies for this

Location is @

2 DeKorte Park Plaza

Lyndhurst, NJ 07071

Phone:[masked]

Navigation or GPS. Or

Directions: Take Route 17 South; cross over Route 3 (divided highway ends after Route 3) to the first traffic light (Quality Inn will be on your left). Make a left onto Polito – At the STOP sign make a left onto Valley Brook Avenue. Follow this road to the end (approx. 1 ½ miles). Cross the railroad tracks (keep to the left). The Meadowlands Environment Center is the first building on the left after the tracks. The second building houses Commission administrative offices. The third building, across from the administrative offices, is the Science Center and Observatory.

More info:

http://mec.rst2.edu/environment/astronomy-information/

Questions?

[masked]


Robert
results.name: Astronomy Night @ the Meadowlands Observatory W Nature Walk

results.description:
Join us for a 45-minute cross-training workout designed to build strength, flexibility and endurance in your running fitness. Each of our workouts is created and led by a certified coach who will take care to ensure you have proper form and get the most out of every session.  There will be no charge for this session.

The workout will consist of a fast-paced circuit of  movement exercises and short runs that will help you to develop specific muscles, leaving you with the capacity to be stronger, faster and less prone to injury after only a few sessions. 

Pricing:
Your first session is always free to try - we want you to know what you’re signing up for. 

This session will be totally free-of-charge. 

One month of unlimited cross-training workouts is available for $30. Two months of unlimited cross-training are yours for only $50. 


Disclaimer:
All fitness programs come with some risk of injury. By agreeing to participate, you confirm that you’re of adequate fitness that you can comfortably run 3-4 miles at a time. Please let your coach know of any injuries or conditions that may limit your ability to complete this session safely - safety is of primary importance, and your coach will do everything possible to make the workout safe, fun and rewarding. 

- - - - - - 
Please see our full calendar of events
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/
connect with us on Google+

Island Labs is doing 3 presentations at LI-Con, which is like a miniature comic-con. (lots of gaming, lots of costumed attendees, lots of Science Fiction fans)

1) Quad Copters (Drones, multicopters, etc)

2) Build your own Robot Army (this is a hands-on workshop)

3) Maker Spaces/Workshops (this is talking about having a workshop)

At our regular Wednesday meeting we'll talk about how things went over the 3-day LI-Con weekend, how we can improve our presentations, presentation skills and what (other) projects we can do in front of an audience.

results.description:
Bachata Class-

This is a advanced beginner class that that builds comfortability with the basics of Bachata dancing. The class warm-up will focus on footwork, turns, body movement and proper technique. Students will learn about proper frame and connection in order to build comfort with leading and following, all while learning a fun dance pattern to use on their next romantic night out!

* The class will include a 10 minute social dance session in order to encourage dancers to practice their new material, along with building comfort and confidence in a fun and relaxed atmosphere!

Participation fee: $15 per person or $50 for 4-week session

This is a weekly class that is regularly attended, the attendance shown for this event does not reflect the full attendance of the class, space is limited - Please RSVP if you would like to join us! 

New to our studio? Try your first class for FREE!

PLEASE TEXT rsvp[masked] - Cathy

MID PARK BEHIND REC CENTER @ HANDBALL COURTS (MAP ON THIS LINK) https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness/photos/gm.383293988527791/596413443794335/?type=1&theater


NO ONE UPTOWN OFFERS POUND - this is a great opportunity to try a "NEW" FUN and different Calorie torching work out!!!


645am-715am - Pound Rock Out Work out - total body

you will need to bring, 

Yourself, Sneakers, comfortable clothes.

At least one water bottle (trust me, you’ll need it!) and a towel for all that sweat. If you have one, a heart rate monitor is an awesome fitness tool that instructors and students alike typically use to measure exercise intensity during classes. 

You may want gloves, & a Mat as we are going to get down and dirty, pullups, push ups, planks, knee tucks, Dragon push ups, hand walks, etc... so dress accordingly and get excited to have some fun while shaping up!!!.

WHY POUND? in shape magazine April 21 http://www.shape.com/fitness/workouts/15-next-big-fitness-trends

POUND is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 400 and 900+ calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique – all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Through continual upper body motion using our lightly weighted drumsticks, called Ripstix™, you'll turn into a calorie-torching drummer, POUNDing off pounds as each song flies by. Rock, rap, dubstep, pop and old school music fuse to create the POUNDtrack series, which is hand-selected by music enthusiasts, drummers and POUND founders Kirsten Potenza and Cristina Peerenboom.

GET RIPPED WITH RIPSTIX™

What would a drumming workout be without drumsticks? We’ve invented unique, lightly weighted exercise drumsticks that have been specially designed to get you ripped — hence the name: Ripstix™

Twice the weight of a standard drumstick (¼ lb each) and slightly shorter in length, Ripstix are designed to maximize your workout by alter the physics of your arm movement to burn more calories

IT WORKS.

POUND combines easy to follow (and not complex or embarrassing) cardio moves with strength training and drumming. This combo works the entire body, raises the heart rate to a fat-burning zone, and forces each move to be as precise as a basic beat.

Each 2-4 minute song is carefully calibrated with interval peaks and extended fat burning sequences, providing you with the best workout in the shortest span of time. After you’re done rocking out to the 45-minute POUNDtrack, you’ll have done 15,000 reps, performed over 30 extended interval peaks, and zipped through over 70 techniques without even realizing it

I am offering 1 week free, then a 15.00 contribution to workout material is appreciated per week. 

please watch my video to get an idea of how much fun we can have getting that beach body!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SEfy9XKiqQc

please visit my website: catgarlo.com 

 facebook: CatGarloFitness and see some reviews. Photos and invites on here as well.

https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness

results.description:
BNI Chapter 17 – Referrals in Motion

We invite you to visit our weekly networking meeting, and let us help you grow your business. Every Thursday, we meet to develop our business relationships; and every day we work together to bring quality referrals and new business to our colleagues in Chapter 17.

Chapter 17 meets every Thursday morning from 7:00am to 8:30am at Hunt & Fish Club, 125 W 44th St, New York, NY. This week our featured speaker is Alex Helbling of Paychex, Inc.


Breakfast is FREE for visitors.

Please bring 50+ business cards to pass to everyone in the room and be prepared to tell the room who you are, what you do and who a perfect referral for you would be. Be specific!

BNI is unique in that membership is limited to one professional per profession - meaning that each one of our members locks out the competition by representing a specific category of business.  Email with questions or for more information.

You will meet quality professionals in these industries: CPA, business coach, voice/data/security, mortgage banker/broker, office machines, photographer, acupuncture, executive recruiting, payroll services, architect, residential real estate, health/life/disability insurance, computer consulting, title insurance, chiropractor, trust & estate attorney, real estate attorney, background screening, foreign currency exchange, financial advisor, property & casualty insurance, bookkeeping, graphic design, business/career strategic advisor, art dealer/advisor, office furniture, commercial real estate, business attorney, personal injury attorney and catering/Asian restaurant.

Desired Member Categories Event Planner

• IT support and consulting

• Business Banker

• Personal Trainer

• Travel Agent

• Florist

• Massage Therapist

• Printing Services

• Dentist

• Matrimonial Attorney

• Immigration Attorney

• and many more!

group.name: BNI Chapter 17 - Referrals in Motion NYC

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

HIIT, as the name suggests, combines high-intensity, calorie-torching periods of activity with low-intensity recovery periods for an overall duration of as little as 10 minutes each session. Some studies have shown that HIIT burns up to nine times more fat than traditional cardiovascular exercise and keeps your metabolism elevated for more than 24 hours afterwards. This means you are going to keep burning calories long after you have finished exercising.

Boot Camp Workout. This intense circuit keeps your heart rate up, burns calories, and tones your whole body. With these circuits we will use body weight exercises alternating with calisthenics.

Women helping women train to find their inner warrior ! Walking can do so much more for you then get you from point A to B. It's a great way to tone up and increase your fitness and health.

With the support and comraderie of other women of all fitness levels , we come together to walk and add in moderate intervals of body movement workouts as we power through the beautiful scenery of Tibbets Brook Park.

results.description:
Three distinct neighborhoods in Manhattan with unique beats yet connected in proximity and creativity. Come explore SoHo’s architectural treasures and learn of it’s art, shopping, culture and more. We will also experience how Italians have shaped  the most iconic Italian enclave in the U.S. We then later finish exploring sections on the largest Chinatown in North America.

Itinerary: 
• SoHo’s Cast-Iron District 
• Richard Haas Mural on Spring St. 
• Haughwout Building 
• The Italian American Museum 
• Church of the Most Precious Blood 
• Mahayana Buddhist Temple 
• Columbus Park 
• And More

Experience a cultural patrimony that will connect you to sections of New York and also the world.


Reservations: 
Required. You must RSVP. Please, if you RSVP and later realize you will not be able to attend change your reservation ASAP.


Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the Apple Store in SoHo on 103 Prince St. map here (Prince St. side). Tour concludes at Columbus Park map here.


Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.


Some of the Sights we will experience:


I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!
results.how_to_find_us: Participants meet in front of the Apple Store in SoHo on the Prince St. Side.
results.name: The Art and Culture of SoHo, Little Italy and Chinatown

*This meetup is part of our "New York City Weekend" line up of events from August 20th-23rd, 2015 that allows locals and those who do not live in Nyc an opportunity to enjoy "The Single One In The Group Meetup Events" together! 

This event will be the first of several events over the course of the weekend. The idea is to give all followers of the blog/meetup members an opportunity to participate in our meetup events... even if you don't live in NYC. 

To accommodate those who can't attend every event during the weekend, I will post all events separately in order to have an accurate count of anticipated attendance.

The weekend will begin with this meetup: A Meet & Greet Happy Hour which will welcome in those from out of town, those who may be new to the group or who have not yet experienced a "Single One In The Group" meetup. This will allow us to mingle together and get to know one another.

The venue has agreed to offer us OPEN BAR for 1 hour, provided that we stay for at least 3 hours total. After the comped hour, each person will be responsible for their own food and beverage consumption. You can pre-purchase additional hours of open bar at $20 per person plus tax and gratuity. If you have any questions about this options just let me know!


Some locations are TBA, as I am trying to find the perfect venue to accommodate us, based on our group size. I will continue to update those events as I solidify more details and decide on a venue. Hope to see you guys there!

I WELCOME any suggestions as well!

AGENDA

5:30pm      Doors Open

6:00pm     Introduction to Firebase (30 mins)  customized with github examples: https://intro-to-firebase-ny.firebaseapp.com/#/

6:45pm      Quick Start Guides: (10 mins) -- Watch Videos

• Android Quickstart  -- and Video (3 mins)

• iOS Quickstart -- and Video (3 mins)

• Web Quickstart -- and Video (3 mins)

7:00pm     Firebase Code Lab (60 mins) 

• Android Track

• Web Track

Note: 

We will have a speaker (Ralph) walk through one of the tracks (Web) live, but we encourage everyone to bring a laptop and work through one or both tracks on their own. 

If you choose to work on the codelab, please  create a Firebase account beforehand and bring a charged laptop. Also, if you plan to do the Android track, make sure you have Android Studio pre-installed.

Resources (for front-end options):

• angular-fire

•  geo-fire (emphasis on geo-tagging data)

•  polymer-firebase 

•  ReactFire 

•  EmberFire

• Android-firebase

• iOS-firebase



8:00pm Lightning Talks

1. Heroku on Compute Engine  (Speaker: Chris Grant)

An introduction to Deis, a self hosted PaaS, that allows for a Heroku like workflow. In this talk I'll cover setup, workflow, and considerations for a Deis cluster on Compute Engine.  

2. Project Tango & VR Demo (Speaker: Lex Dreitser)


GDG NY held the first Project Tango hackathon on Aug 8. Lex Dreiser (a participant and hackathon winner) will demo his winning entry and talk about Project Tango and Unity, setting the stage for more talks in future.


8:30pm Doors Close

LIGHTNING TALKS:

IF you have worked with Firebase and have a demo or app that you want to showcase, contact the organizer OR leave a comment below. You can also fill in our speaker form here (http://bit.ly/gdgny-speaker-signup)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE MEETING TIME HAS BEEN CHANGED TO 6PM. Meet in front of the museum.  Look for me or John. Our photos are to the left under Organizers. You can also text me at 9172028334.

Join us for Pay What you Wish Thursday at Museum of Arts of Design. There are a few great exhibits on view right now. Below is our schedule: 

6pm-645pm - Floors 4 & 5 - PATHMAKERS: WOMEN IN ART CRAFT AND DESIGN , MID-CENTURY AND TODAY explores the important contributions of women to modernism. During the 1950s and 60s, painting, sculpture, and architecture were dominated by men; women however had considerable impact in alternative materials such as textiles, ceramics, and metals. Largely unexamined in major art historical surveys these pioneering women achieved international success, establishing a model of professional identity for future women.

[masked] - Floor 3 - RICHARD ESTES PAINTING NEW YORK CITY presents works by this quintessential New York artist and leader of the Photorealist movement. Paintings and works on paper, including his photographs, silkscreens and woodcuts from the 1960s to present are on view.

[masked] Floor 2 - RALPH PUCCI THE ART OF THE MANNEQUIN is the first museum exhibition to explore the work of revered designer Ralph Pucci, who is widely noted for his innovative and expressive approach to the everyday form of the mannequin. Pucci’s mannequins not only artfully expand the parameters of this familiar sculptural form, but reflect cultural trends of the past three decades as he has collaborated with fashion icons such as Diane von Furstenberg, Patrick Naggar, Kenny Scharf, Anna Sui, Isabel and Ruben Toledo and Christy Turlington. Over 30 of his mannequins will be on view. 

Keep a copy of the schedule if you would like to stay with the group. Everyone moves at a different pace but it is here to give you a general idea where we will be at different times. At 800 - 815 we will wait for everyone to reconvene in front of the building so we can all go get a snack or drink in Columbus Circle  - Location tbd. Hope to see you!!

http://madmuseum.org/sites/default/files/styles/popup/public/2015/03/PUCCI_MAIN_IMAGE_04%5B2%5D.jpg?itok=d309fPAO
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in front of the museum at 6:00. Look for me or John. Our photos are to the left under Organizers. You can also text me at 9172028334.
results.name: Museum of Arts and Design Pay What You Wish Thursday

Dear Smart Networkers,

Join us in this exciting facilitated networking event where you will have opportunity to showcase your business through elevator pitches, learn power networking tips, and network with phenomenal business owners! Tell everyone how you stand out and how all others can refer business to you. This is a perfect way to market yourself and develop a targeted network.

The tips on networking will cover:

• Five deadly pitfalls of networking.

• How to follow up.

• How to make the most of networking events.

We will follow a structured format :

6:00-6:15pm - open networking/registration

6:15-6:25pm - 30 secs elevator pitches

6:25-6:45pm - Brief networking tips from Dr. Kool 

6:45-7:00pm - Brainstorming session

results.description:
All Bisexual, Non-monosexual, and all other Queer-identified and Bi-friendly people are invited to come join people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic oriented discussion at  BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.

about us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest is a bisexual social discussion group serving the New York City metropolitan area since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals and bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion group session, at 8 o'clock we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion. We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

results.description:
Paul Katsen is co-founder and CEO of Blockspring.  Blockspring aims to index the world's APIs and make it easy to access and integrate data across multiple APIs (internal to your company and APIs outside your company) in one spreadsheet.   

Paul will walk through what an API is, why APIs are important to your discipline, and how you can use them to access a myriad of finance, social, marketing, paid and open data sources. He will also walk through examples of integrating data from multiple APIs. All done with a spreadsheet.

I define Big data not only 'big' but also hard to get at data, new forms of data, and APIs makes accessing some of that data easy. 

Here's a description from Andreessen : 

http://a16z.com/2015/07/29/blockspring/

And an article from Wired: 

http://www.wired.com/2015/07/blockspring/

Paul holds dual B.S. degrees from the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign in Finance and Engineering.  He participated in YC which helped fund Blockspring, and recently obtained funding from Andreessen.


Here's his awesome blog on the future of APIs: 

http://katsenblog.com

and of course ... the link to Blockspring itself: https://www.blockspring.com
results.name: APIs without Coding - Making Data Accessible and Data Science Easier

results.description:
Due to unprecedented schedule changes, our August 21 event date has been postponed for next month. Please take an opportunity to attend this FREE event at The Intrepid on August 20.


This event is hosted by The Intrepid, Sea, Air and Space Museum.

~


In this harrowing true story, NASA must devise a strategy to return Apollo 13 safely to Earth after the spacecraft undergoes massive internal damage, putting the lives of the three astronauts on board in jeopardy.

Introduced by Jeffrey Kluger, co-author of the book Apollo 13

Jeffrey Kluger is editor-at-large of Time magazine and Time.com and the author of nine books. His first book, co-authored with former astronaut Jim Lovell, was Apollo 13, which served as the basis of the 1995 movie. Kluger admits that when he was a boy, Lovell was his favorite astronaut—a fact that compelled him to approach Lovell in 1992 about working on a book together. Early responses to the book were not encouraging. They were told, "Nobody wants to read about three guys who didn't land on the moon 22 years ago." As it turned out, many people did.
results.name: Summer Movies on The Intrepid: Apollo 13

As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.


Enter “The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares” aka the World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Bitcoin Trading Pit! 

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups, as we are an incubator for these. Gaze upon MiningBot and Cash2BTC, two examples of path-breaking Bitcoin hardware the center co-developed. Meet or become a center sponsor and get exposure among the right audience and media!

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

results.description:
Arduino Essentials  is designed to take you beyond  the basics and get you ready to start working on your own  Arduino project.   This six week course will equip tech-friendly beginners with the confidence and skills to use the Arduino platform in multiple future projects.

This is a hands-on course which is designed around a sample project that you build and take home with you at the end of the six weeks.  Each session will focus on a different essential a skill and help you overcome several ‘hurdles’  that have been observed to discourage  those who attempt to solve problems using Arduino. 

Cost: $225 for the full six week course

***Prepayment is required for this course.  One you respond yes on meetup we will reach out to you with payment options.



Digital I/O

• Switches and pull-up resistors

• Driving LED’s

• Power considerations

Analog I/O

• What is an ADC

• PWM

Program Flow Control

• FOR

• IF

• SWITCH CASE

• DELAY

Serial Communication

• Using the Serial Monitor

Interface and Drivers

• Bipolar Transistors and MOSFETs

• Driver chips (ULN2003, ULN2804, LB1205)

• Stepper shields

• H Bridge shields
results.name: Arduino Essentials - It's time to move beyond blink (5 of 6 Sessions)

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
The Adorama Gallery and Epson are pleased to present Julio’s House, a series by Orestes Gonazalez. The exhibition will be on view Thursday August 20th through Friday September 11th.


An opening reception will be held on Thursday August 20th from 6-8pm. RSVP for the event here. Hope to see you there!

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We’re just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue – 14th Street subway station.

To learn more about this show, please visit our AdoramaNYC blog page.

Artist's Statement:

Perception, Recognition & Discovery

In the Spring of 2007, Julio Santana died peacefully in a nursing home. My Aunt Seida asked me to help her sort out his house and go through the trove of mementos he had left behind. Julio was the younger brother of Seida’s husband, Rene. As such, he was never a big presence in my life growing up in 1970’s Miami.

As a child I remember going to his soirees, filled with hairstylists, decorators, designers, actors, bon vivants and family members. His extravagant house was an ad hoc mixture of Las Vegas and Versailles. Wine and drugs flowed freely and it felt frivolous, decadent and very superficial--not much deeper than surface decoration. So very different from the macho Cuban environment I grew up in. Julio, an openly gay man, was not actively pursued for his company by my parents, as he was in their opinion, “not a good influence on the kids.”

As I perused his photographs and papers, a lineal description of his life started to emerge… and it was very different from my childhood perception of him. I discovered an old photo of Julio as a skinny kid from a small town just outside of Havana and another showing him as a young adult preforming a magic show on a boat in front of a crowd of humorless American tourists.

My Aunt explained in the 1950’s Julio worked every night on the Floridita, a ferry between Miami and Havana. “He fed all his brothers and sisters in Cuba for years doing that and if it weren’t for him, neither Rene nor I would be here today.”

My curiosity was piqued, so I pressed Seida to explain further. Apparently Julio moved to Miami in 1959, got his papers and paid for seven family members to come to America. Once here, he helped them financially until we were on their feet. He borrowed money and waited tables in Miami Beach, doing double shifts 6 days a week for years and was in debt for the longest time.

Wow… all the silly flocked wallpaper, silk flowers, heavy drapes and overly ornate furniture that surrounded me didn’t seem so frivolous any more. It felt more like a fantasy escape to another world. This flamboyant man who I had never paid much attention to, suddenly became the savior of his family. Never had such an impression of someone changed so suddenly for me.

I am fascinated with how mankind works to interpret its past and embrace its future in this ever-changing world. As individuals we are shaped by our memories and upbringings; our cultural values define our opinions about the world. As the economy, technology and social policy evolve, we are pushed to constantly reassess our beliefs and who we are at our very core. As our society develops, so does the recognition and discovery of our true selves.

In this highly personal series, I delve into my changing perception of Julio. I explore the physical space in which he lived and examine the objects that he surrounded himself by. I’ve come to strangely appreciate the gaudy decadence of his home, representing his dream to come to the US. Learning that he paid for it with his hard-earned money after helping his family escape from 1960’s Cuba made it all that more poignant.

As a gay man myself I felt a great pride when I learned of his courage and dedication to a family that eschewed his lifestyle.

– Orestes Gonzalez, 2015

Artist's Bio:

As an architect, Orestes Gonzalez is very conscious of proportion, scale and the overall effect of space upon its inhabitants. His images of interiors, people and monuments document man’s foibles and experiences on both a grand and personal scale.

Orestes, a pillar in the Long Island City arts community, shoots for a monthly photo column “Orestes LIC” in LIC Courier Magazine, documenting the changes and activities in the most rapidly developing neighborhood of Queens.

The first chapter of his photo essay, Portraits of Artists is viewable on Vimeo and depicts fellow artists in their workspaces in his community. This series will continue with artists from Miami, Havana, Buenos Aires and Nova Scotia. Portraits of Artists will culminate in his second monograph book, which is currently in the preliminary production stage. His first self-published monograph, Street Life, is for sale on his website.

Orestes is currently working on a long-term photo project, Cuban Portraits, which will depict Cuban families in their personal living spaces in both Miami and Havana.

His work has been published in magazines and has works in corporate and private collections. He has exhibited in galleries in New York, Miami and Buenos Aires.

To see more of Orestes Gonzales projects, visit his site.

For gallery inquiries please contact [masked]
results.name: Gallery Opening: Julio's House a series by Orestes Gonzalez

results.description:
The Adorama Gallery and Epson are pleased to present Julio’s House, a series by Orestes Gonazalez. The exhibition will be on view Thursday August 20th through Friday September 11th.


An opening reception will be held on Thursday August 20th from 6-8pm. RSVP for the event through Eventbrite.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We’re just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue – 14th Street subway station.

To learn more about this show, please visit our AdoramaNYC blog page.

Artist's Statement: 

Perception, Recognition & Discovery

In the Spring of 2007, Julio Santana died peacefully in a nursing home. My Aunt Seida asked me to help her sort out his house and go through the trove of mementos he had left behind. Julio was the younger brother of Seida’s husband, Rene. As such, he was never a big presence in my life growing up in 1970’s Miami.

As a child I remember going to his soirees, filled with hairstylists, decorators, designers, actors, bon vivants and family members. His extravagant house was an ad hoc mixture of Las Vegas and Versailles. Wine and drugs flowed freely and it felt frivolous, decadent and very superficial--not much deeper than surface decoration. So very different from the macho Cuban environment I grew up in. Julio, an openly gay man, was not actively pursued for his company by my parents, as he was in their opinion, “not a good influence on the kids.”

As I perused his photographs and papers, a lineal description of his life started to emerge… and it was very different from my childhood perception of him. I discovered an old photo of Julio as a skinny kid from a small town just outside of Havana and another showing him as a young adult preforming a magic show on a boat in front of a crowd of humorless American tourists. 

My Aunt explained in the 1950’s Julio worked every night on the Floridita, a ferry between Miami and Havana. “He fed all his brothers and sisters in Cuba for years doing that and if it weren’t for him, neither Rene nor I would be here today.”

My curiosity was piqued, so I pressed Seida to explain further. Apparently Julio moved to Miami in 1959, got his papers and paid for seven family members to come to America. Once here, he helped them financially until we were on their feet. He borrowed money and waited tables in Miami Beach, doing double shifts 6 days a week for years and was in debt for the longest time.

 Wow… all the silly flocked wallpaper, silk flowers, heavy drapes and overly ornate furniture that surrounded me didn’t seem so frivolous any more. It felt more like a fantasy escape to another world. This flamboyant man who I had never paid much attention to, suddenly became the savior of his family. Never had such an impression of someone changed so suddenly for me. 

I am fascinated with how mankind works to interpret its past and embrace its future in this ever-changing world. As individuals we are shaped by our memories and upbringings; our cultural values define our opinions about the world. As the economy, technology and social policy evolve, we are pushed to constantly reassess our beliefs and who we are at our very core. As our society develops, so does the recognition and discovery of our true selves. 

In this highly personal series, I delve into my changing perception of Julio. I explore the physical space in which he lived and examine the objects that he surrounded himself by. I’ve come to strangely appreciate the gaudy decadence of his home, representing his dream to come to the US. Learning that he paid for it with his hard-earned money after helping his family escape from 1960’s Cuba made it all that more poignant. 

As a gay man myself I felt a great pride when I learned of his courage and dedication to a family that eschewed his lifestyle.

 – Orestes Gonzalez, 2015 

Artist's Bio: 

As an architect, Orestes Gonzalez is very conscious of proportion, scale and the overall effect of space upon its inhabitants. His images of interiors, people and monuments document man’s foibles and experiences on both a grand and personal scale.

Orestes, a pillar in the Long Island City arts community, shoots for a monthly photo column “Orestes LIC” in LIC Courier Magazine, documenting the changes and activities in the most rapidly developing neighborhood of Queens.

The first chapter of his photo essay, Portraits of Artists is viewable on Vimeo and depicts fellow artists in their workspaces in his community. This series will continue with artists from Miami, Havana, Buenos Aires and Nova Scotia. Portraits of Artists will culminate in his second monograph book, which is currently in the preliminary production stage. His first self-published monograph, Street Life, is for sale on his website.

Orestes is currently working on a long-term photo project, Cuban Portraits, which will depict Cuban families in their personal living spaces in both Miami and Havana.

His work has been published in magazines and has works in corporate and private collections. He has exhibited in galleries in New York, Miami and Buenos Aires.

results.description:
Come Join us for a Bike Ride after work starting on the Walkway over the Hudson, crossing over to the Hudson Valley Rail Trail and then back over the Walkway over the Hudson to the Dutchess County Rail Trail. Please CLICK the links throughout this description for maps and/or website information.

The entire ride is paved and open to all levels.  A Road Bike or Hybrid is recommended but a Mountain Bike can be used if you don't mind going slower.  The group may naturally break up depending on varying skill levels.

We will meet at 6:00pm at the Poughkeepsie Entrance at 61 Parker Avenue, Poughkeepsie, NY 12601

Parking Fee: There is Free Parking in the dirt lot bordering the road with no time restrictions. (The paved lot behind that requires a NYS Empire Passport or $5. for up to 4 hours and you must be out by sunset - I don't recommend parking in the NYS Parks "paved" lot for this event)


Have all your gear ready and plan to start promptly by 6:15pm.

We will all ride at our own pace until roughly 8:30pm.  That should give us enough time to cover the Walkway over the Hudson, the Hudson Valley Rail Trail and a good portion of the Dutchess County Rail Trail.

At roughly 7:45pm we turn around from wherever we are and return to our start point.


MANDATORY GEAR:

• Road Bike, Hybrid or Mountain Bike

• Bicycle Helmet

• Headlamp with spare batteries

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.



For those who would like to join me for some Food after the ride I will be heading over to the:

West Indies Restaurant

105 Main St


Poughkeepsie, NY 12601


(845)[masked] 


Specialties

Jerk chicken, Oxtail, Curry Goat/chicken, stew beef, stew chicken, jerk pork...served with your choice of Rice & peas or white rice, Dumplings, yams, bananas...steam cabbage or mixed vegetable on the side.
PATTIES..BEEF, VEG, CHICKEN, Spinach
Natural jamaican drinks. Carrot Juice, Irish Moss

History

Established in 2000.

Family owned and operated...We take pride in our meals..everything cook fresh daily..known as the # 1 authentic jamaican food around town..come in and enjoy...

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member.


To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!

Using Dive Computers

Computers are relatively inexpensive and very reliable. Introduction to Dive Computers

</a>

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/pdfs/whybuymyown.pdf">Why Buy My Own Equipment? Diving more than most other sports requires reliable equipment and instruction on its proper use. Don’t listen to an inexperienced expert or be fooled by the online hype, you get the best gear right here, from the people you can trust.

EQUIPMENT: You are responsible for having all the gear you need to dive this weekend. Arrange equipment rentals with the shop.and pick up any rental equipment you will need. SDI Logbook

Planning Slate

Equipment requirements for Certification Dives

Wetsuit (6mm or 7mm)

Hood

Weights and weight belt

BCD (Buoyancy Compensator Device)

Regulator

Dive Computer 

SCUBA Cylinder

You should reserve your equipment in advance and pick it up before the weekend. You are responsible for transporting all the equipment needed to complete your certification dives.

Let's climb together at this newly opened indoor rock climbing spot - The Cliffs at LIC - the newest & largest indoor rock climbing gym in NYC area. Mention NYC Active group for receive specials for our meetups (Listed below). 

Specials for our meetup:

• First-time climbers will receive free rental gear. It must be the first visit to the facility and with scheduled meet-up.
• The $99 initiation fee is waived for month-to-month membership for meet-up members if they sign up on a meet-up day.
• Meet-up members will receive 50% off (enter promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD) on the Climbing 101 class on the day of their meet-up. Classes must be booked in advance.

The Cliffs at LIC features:

Expertly-set routes for all levels of climbing experience + ability 
• Over 30,000 square feet of climbing terrain
• Over 125 top rope stations and tons of lead climbing
• 16-foot top-out bouldering
• Professional instructors with a passion for climbing
• Separate Party Room for events + classes
• Full fitness gym
No experience necessary!
Each participant must have a waiver (to be filled out by a parent or guardian for participants under 18)!

Date/Time: Every Thursday 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm

REGULAR PRICING Posted at Cliffs LIC Website

Day Pass // $28
College Day Pass* // $24
1-Month Pass // $140

CLIMBING 101: TOPROPE BASICS

The facility includes climbing & fitness

Location (Map)

[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101 
(718) 729-ROCK (7625)

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

If you are a total beginner to indoor climbing (never climbed or belayed before), you will need to take a class. Please book "Climbing 101: TopRope Basics" at 6:30 pm on Tuesday by entering promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD or call[masked] & mention NYC Active meetup to get 50% off. This class will teach you how to tie the rope and belay your climbing partner. Gear rental is included in the class. You can still do boulder without taking the class or being belay certified though.

If you are new to The Cliffs at LIC but have been belayed certified in other gym, you can take a test & it will only take few minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please feel free to see me & we can practice together.

results.description:
Event agenda: 

6:30 - 7:00 PM: Networking & Food 
7:00 - 7:15 PM: Lightning Talks (5 mins each) 
7:15 - 8:30 PM: Keynote talk by Sandy Griffith
8:30 - 9:00 PM: Socializing

Lightning Talks: 

We would like to have three 5-minute talks + 1 minutes Q&A. This can simply be an introduction to the group about who you are and what you work on, or you can cover some aspect of Machine Learning or Data Science that you find interesting.  This is open to everyone and we encourage people of all skill levels to give a talk.  It's a great way to introduce yourself to the group! 

So grab a spot here and tell us more about what you are passionate about and the awesome things you are working on.

Keynote talk:

Flatiron Health organizes the world’s oncology information and makes it useful for patients, physicians, life science companies and researchers. Flatiron Health’s platform connects cancer centers across the country on a common technology infrastructure, supporting treatment for about 1 in 5 active cancer patients in the U.S. Working with such complex real-world oncology data presents unique and interesting challenges from a statistical perspective. Sandy will share some of these challenges and corresponding statistical approaches, focusing on issues of uncertainty, missingness, sensitivity analysis, and prediction.  

Speaker bio:

Dr. Sandy Griffith is a biostatistician and technical lead at Flatiron Health based in NYC. Prior to this role, she was Assistant Professor of Medicine in the Department of Quantitative Health Sciences at Cleveland Clinic and Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine. Sandy holds a PhD in biostatistics from the University of Pennsylvania. Her areas of research focus on electronic health records, incomplete data, data quality, and patient-reported outcomes.

This month Mike Carson will present from Chicago. 

Mike Carson is the CEO of Integrated Technology and Design Inc (itdwebdesign.com), and the well-known online storefront called JoomlaShowroom.com where they develop and distribute their Joomla extensions.

Mike has been designing Joomla websites and developing very popular Joomla extensions since the infancy of the Joomla project (the Mambo days). Mike cannot even think of developing a website using any other framework other than the Joomla! Platform. Mike also speaks at various Joomla CMS related events and has a real passion for teaching people about this award winning content management system we call Joomla! Mike's unique entrepreneurial experience, combined with his uncanny ability to listen to the market and deliver winning solutions on a consistent basis make him a "must-attend" session for business people and developers alike at the conferences he speaks at.

results.description:
This week we pedal north, through Central Park, past the copy of the "House that Ruth built", and to the best, affordable food place I've had in a while. It's my current favourite. The ride will return to Columbus Circle after our eats and hangout time.

We will do our best to stick together and always ask a volunteer to ride as sweep but please have someone’s number to call if you get separated from the group. There are a few stretches where everyone will be invited to pedal at their preferred pace and mass up points will be called out along the route…so grab your bike and bring your friends!

WHEN: Meet up at 6:30 pm, Wheels down at 7:00 pm!


MEET-UP: USS Maine National Monument, Columbus Circle1849 Broadway, NY, NY 10023http://goo.gl/maps/qUIEL


END SPOT: La Nueva Win Hing 40 E 167th St, Bronx, NY 10452http://www.yelp.com/biz/la-nueva-win-hing-restaurant-bronx


ROUTE: TBA


DISTANCE: <20

Ever endeavoring to turn social cyclists into cycling commuters.The goals are to ride bikes and hang out with friends that love riding bikes.


Feel free to contact us with any questions/[masked]


CAUTION: If you like to ride ahead of the lead, please be sure to test the route for your own safety and for the safety of anyone that doesn't know the route and follows you. Feel free to ride ahead on bridges as we always mass up on the other side.


WHAT YOU NEED:


NYC Department of Transportation Bicycle Laws, Rules & Regulations require: White headlight and red taillight must be used from dusk to dawn, bell or other audible signal (not whistle), working brakes, and reflective tires and/or other reflective devices.


Social Cycling NYC strongly recommends that every cyclist: Follows NYC DOT rules, EXPECTS all cyclists to accept personal responsibility for their own actions (or lack thereof), and recommends cyclists bring/use bikes, helmets, locks, IDs, money for food and drinks, and cycling friends!


HOW: WE ride AS traffic and NOT AGAINST it. We stop at red lights, yield the right of way and let cars pass as best we can. We don't block intersections. We are nice to both our fellow riders and the other traffic on the road. LISTEN TO the volunteers helping to lead the ride. They are some nice people and have your best interests in mind. If you have any questions about the rules, please check here: http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6


REMINDER: The goal is to create a safe environment for all riders, but we cannot control, nor do we desire to, every rider's behavior. We promote personal responsibility and all riders are responsible for themselves. If you choose to ride with us, then you accept the risks inherent in riding a bicycle with a large group of other people riding bicycles.


Social Cycling New York City is modeled after Social Cycling Austin.https://www.facebook.com/socialcyclingaustin/info

A philosophy professor in the grip of an existential crisis begins an affair with a student in Woody Allen’s IRRATIONAL MAN, one of the filmmaker’s finest modern films and a critical favorite at its Cannes Film Festival premiere. Abe Lucas is at rock bottom emotionally, unable to find any meaning or joy in life. Soon after arriving to teach at a small town college, Abe gets involved with two women and makes a profound choice, setting off a chain of events that will affect him forever. Hope to see you there.

results.description:
Curious about code? Struggling to learn the intricacies of web development on your own? Want to learn face-to-face with others in a welcoming community?

Join us and discover the language that makes the Web interactive: JavaScript. Pressing space on your favorite video streaming site to pause the video? JavaScript. Clicking “Compose” in your Web-based email client and a new message box pops up on the screen? JavaScript.

In this workshop, we will walk you through the basics of the JavaScript language and how to use it to communicate with the HTML/CSS on a web page. We’ll cover:

* All the tools you need to get up, running and coding with JavaScript

* Basic programming concepts like variables, loops, functions, strings, arrays and objects

* How to write these things in JavaScript

* Interacting with the HTML and CSS of a webpage using JavaScript


*Available resources if you’d like to continue learning

This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in the immersive program. Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook). Light snacks will be provided.

Prerequisite: A basic understanding of HTML/CSS and JavaScript (e.g. topics covered in Codecademy’s HTML & CSS and JavaScript tracks).

Build your programming knowledge independently or collectively in our workshop series:
HTML/CSS for Beginners - evening workshop [8/18 from 7-9pm] 
Javascript for Beginners - evening workshop [8/20 from 6:30-9:30pm]  
Ruby for Beginners - evening workshop [8/24 from 6:30-9:30pm] 
Full Stack Development - day long weekend workshop [8/29 from 10am-6pm]
results.name: JavaScript for Beginners: Building Interactive Web Apps on the Frontend

results.description:
we will present a 30 minute overview on convolutional networks. 

convolutional networks have come to dominate image classification tasks. nearly every technology company interested in digital images - including google, facebook, snapchat, baidu, and microsoft - has adopted them in some capacity.

but why do convolutional networks work so well? how do they mimic the visual cortex? how do they generate abstract representations from low-level, primitive visual features? and, more importantly, for those of us without phds in machine learning, can they be implemented with minimal brain damage?

after this meetup, attendees will know how to train convolutional networks, and finally be able to distinguish between cats and dogs!
results.name: a gentle introduction to convolutional networks

•  6:30pm - 7pm: Networking and everyone getting seated

• 7:30pm – 8:00pm: Open Q&A and Audience Interaction 

• 8:00pm – 8:30pm: Announcements and Networking 

"What's Next After Agile?" 

With the exponential growth of the tech ecosystem, there is a current surge of importance to find a newer and more efficient ways of working within smaller and increasingly skillful teams. The adoption of the "Agile Manifesto" and the methodologies that followed helped launched a wave of tech startups and allowed for bigger corporations to create smaller innovation labs to help compete. As we prepare for a more integrated work place and use of artificial intelligence eliminating the need for menial tasks such as PMbot on Slack, are we expecting new methodologies to surface and help streamline our day-to-day tasks? Or as most consultants say "it depends." 

Moderator: Eleanore Hopper (User Experience Manager @ Yodle) 

Panelists:  

Richard Buckman (VP of Engineering @ Yodle) 

David McCarthy (VP, YBN Product Management @ Yodle) 

Paul Hou (Software Engineer @ Facebook) 

Adekunle Oduye (Product Designer @ NASDAQ OMX)
results.name: "What's Next After Agile?" featuring Yodle, Facebook, and NASDAQ

results.description:
This tour is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and a dozen of thier partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending.  If you have any questions contact [masked]

 This will make you happier than a Happy Hour!

Our tours are specifically designed for people who live, work and play in the New York Area.  It is our goal to open your eyes to historical sites and info that you may walk past every day!  Our tours are fun ways to learn about the city while socializing with other fun people from our group. It is amazing that Manhattan, which was once known as the Island of Rolling Hills, has transformed into the Concrete Canyon it is today.  Along the way your professional guide will share historical facts and show you a photographic history that will amaze you.  Be a tourist in your own city and sign up today! For this special tour your will have a chance to experience the new Beer Garden at Tavern on the Green!

Your guide will share with you the history of the park from its heyday to decline and then rebirth. He will show you amazing pictures  from before the park was there to vintage shots from the late 18 and 1900's.  You will learn of it's construction, design, special secrets and more as the sun shines on a  spring day.

The tour lasts about 2 hours

In case or rain and the tour is canceled you may switch to a future date.

PLEASE BRING EXACT CHANGE $15

Can I come alone? yes, 95% of those attending come on their own.

What should I wear?  Most come from work so business casual.

Can I just go to the beer garden? No space in the beer garden is limited and we will only have room for those who are on the tour.

Where does the tour go? You will meet at The Firehouse Tavern from 6:30-7pm for cocktails then go into the park at 85th. You will go from the Great LAwn to Tavern on the Green mostly in the west to middle parts of the park.
results.name: Central Park Sunset Happy Hour History Tour + Cocktails at Tavern on the Green

group.name: 365+ Cool Things To Do With Fun People In New York

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
"If you want to find a Buddha, look into your own [true] nature"  - Bodhidharma

"Think always: 'I am the immortal Self'. This is right thinking" -Swami Sivananda

"Don't you know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit, who is within you" - New Testament

"Man know thyself and you will know the Universe and its gods" - Greek Maxim

Every mystical tradition and authentic religion teaches us that we have the potential to become a Buddha, a Master, an Angel. This is the Path of Self Realization, of discovering our True Nature. Every evening we will be discussing the essential principles of this path with topics such as:


Astral Projection

Awakening our Buddha Nature

The Fire of the Kundalini

Alchemy and Tantra

Tarot and Kabbalah

Practical Astrology

And much more...

Each evening with include an optional practice of Magical Runes, Tibetan Rites for Rejuvenation, Mantra, or Pranayama, etc. We teach in the tradition of Samael Aun Weor.  We hope to see you for an evening of knowledge, practice, and fun!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

.- numbers may not show- phone number in words:

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
